She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her farm.
 
Lolita has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farm .

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela 40, is married and has five children.

Rasela owns and operates a business venture selling a variety of products in the local community. She has many years of experience in this business.    

Rasela needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional products to sell, such as tin fish, flour, sugar, salt, laundry soap and toilet rolls. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST or US $125 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Rasela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Rasela's second loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale of 1 to 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the overall social metric score.  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

About SPBD:

Apolinaria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of eggs to sell in her stall

Celsa has been in this business for 27 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, rice, shampoo and other groceries.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as canned goods, rice, shampoo and other groceries to sell in her general store

Fiatagata owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products in the local community. She has many years of experience in this business.

Fiatagata needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 320 WST or US $133 per week) to financially support the immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Fiatagata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Fiatagata's third loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 1 to 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the overall social metric score. For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is married with two children. She is 31 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez Misamis Occidental.

Madelyn sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 40,000 to purchase stock for her general store.

Madelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Madelyn hope to improve her business and support her family.

loans.name: May Ann

texts.en:
May Ann is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

May Ann has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

May Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, May Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Gloria Stella

texts.es: Gloria Stella de 46 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto con su pequeña hija Ericka  de 7 años la cual se encuentra estudiando. Gloria se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honesta y con muchos deseos de superarse. Para ella lo más importante es su familia. No pierde las esperanzas de algún día ver a su hija convertida en una profesional y con mejores oportunidades de vida. Esto es lo que inspira a Gloria a trabajar duramente en su salón de belleza que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya logró ganarse la confianza de muchas personas. El objetivo Gloria es ampliar su negocio de tal manera que la capacidad del mismo sea más grande y logre cubrir una mayor demanda. Esta inversión piensa hacerla por medio de un crédito ya que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para hacerlo por sus medios. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar los materiales necesarios (peines, secadoras, planchas, artículos para el cabello, tijeras, esmaltes, etc.) para continuar dando el servicio y  lograr el objetivo de ampliar el negocio.  Tiene mucha confianza de alcanzar el objetivo trazado ya que es una mujer perseverante y siempre logra lo que se propone. Confía mucho en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta manera su calidad de vida y la de su familia mejorará.
texts.en:
Gloria Stella is 46 years old and lives in her own home together with her young daughter Ericka who is 7 years old and in school.  Gloria is a hard-working, honest woman who has a great desire to do well.  The most important thing in her life is her family.  She doesn't lose hope of one day seeing her daughter become a professional with better opportunities in life.  This is what inspires Gloria to work hard in her beauty salon which she managed to set up with a great deal of effort.

Gloria has been working in her business for a long time and has gained many people's trust.  Her goal is to expand her business so that she can serve more people and so that she can cope with more demand.  She plans to make this investment through a loan as she doesn't have the money she needs to do it on her own.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to buy the materials she needs (combs, dryers, hair straighteners, haircare products, scissors, nail polish, etc.).  This will enable her to continue providing her service and achieve her aim of expanding her business.  She is very confident that she will achieve her goal as she is a persevering woman who always achieves what she sets out to achieve.  She trusts in God and in her work that, in this way, her own quality of life and that of her family will improve.

loans.use: to buy combs, dryers, hair straighteners, haircare products, scissors, nail polish, etc.

Dorotea has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Dorotea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric to make curtains

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina  49 años D. edad, resiD. en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su compañero D. vida y su hija la cual se encuentra estudiando. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. deliciosas tortillas. Tiene muchos años D. dedicarse a este negocio y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo ha logrado mantenerlo en marcha y espera seguir manteniéndolo activo ya que es su principal fuente D. ingresos. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja día con día con mucha dedicación para algún día poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad D. vida. Muchas personas la prefieren ya que Guillermina se caracteriza por ser una mujer  trabajadora y responsable, además los clientes están satisfechos con las ricas tortillas que elabora día con día. Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra D. la materia prima necesaria (maíz, agua, gas propano, etc.)  Para la elaboración D. las ricas tortillas. No pierD. las esperanzas D. lograr su sueño D. mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 49 years old and lives in her own home together with her family: her life partner and her daughter who is in school.  Guillermina makes and sells delicious tortillas.  She has been in this business for many years and, thanks to God and her own hard work, she has managed to keep her business running.  She hopes to keep her business active as it is her main source of income.  Guillermina's family are the most important thing in her life and they are why she works hard every day, so that some day she can offer them a better quality of life.  Many people are loyal to her business because she is a hard-working and responsible woman.  In addition, her customers are happy with the delicious tortillas that she makes every day.

Guillermina took the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in buying the supplies she needs (corn, water, propane gas, etc.) to make her delicious tortillas.  She doesn't lose hope of one day fulfilling her dream of improving her own quality of life as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, water, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Sadelyn

texts.en:
Sadelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy materials for maintaining her fishing boat.

Sadelyn has been in this business for 13 years. Sadelyn earns more income from a computer shop.

Sadelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials to maintain her fishing boat

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen works hard to support her family. Arleen is married and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Arleen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell to customers.

Arleen has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Arleen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 29 years old and married with two children.

Beverly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Beverly has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and earns additional income from fish vending.

Beverly aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia de 58 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto con sus dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Rosa es una mujer increíble ya que ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su familia es su principal inspiración para seguir luchando y espera algún día lograr mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de productos de elote como: atol, tamales, elotes cocidos, etc. Gracias a su carisma y amabilidad ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas en la zona y cada día son más las personas que demandan sus deliciosos tamales y sabroso atol. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la materia prima necesaria (elotes, azúcar, sal, agua, aceite, gas propano, etc.) para la elaboración de los tamales y atol que cada día ofrece con mucho amor y cariño a todas las personas que requieren de ellos. Espera poder lograr resultados positivos y poder tener acceso a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa Emilia is 58 years old. She lives in her own house together with her two children, both of whom are in school. Rosa is an incredible woman who has worked her entire life to provide for her children. Her family is her principal source of inspiration to keep fighting. She hopes that one day she will improve the quality of their life. She prepares and sells corn foods, such as: hot corn drinks, tamales, cooked corn on the cob, etc. It is thanks to her charisma and kindness that she has been able to win the trust of so many people in the region. Every day there are more people who request her delicious tamales and her tasty corn drinks. She has made the decision of requesting this loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) to invest in the purchase of the necessary ingredients (corn, sugar, salt, water, cooking oil, propane gas, etc.) to make her tamales and corn drink. Every day she offers these for sale with great love and attention to all those who have need of these. She hopes to attain positive results and to have access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, sugar, salt, water, cooking oil, and propane gas.

loans.name: Ritche

texts.en:
Ritche is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Ritche has a shop that sells vegetables like eggplants, string beans & "sayote". He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Ritche has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ritche hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina has the drive and attitude to succeed. She is 48 years old, married and has eight children. Four of them are grown up and the rest attend school. Her children's interest and willingness to learn motivates her to work hard and provide their needs for a good education. Her family lives near the public market so she established a small store selling food and daily use products such as soap, shampoo, instant noodles, sardines, oil and bread. Profits earned go to school fees and allowances for her children.

Marina would like to sell more grocery items including fruits and vegetables but she has insufficient funds and that is why she is now asking for loan of P10,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, fruits and vegetables to sell and boost her earnings.

In the future, she wants to establish a larger store and keep growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Elizabeth has a cooked food shop or "carenderia" that sells viands like "adobo", "pancit bihon" & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Stefany Elizabeth

texts.es: Stefany Elizabeth de 23 años de edad, reside en casa familiar junto  con sus padres. Stefany es una joven emprendedora y llena de sueños. Ella trabaja duramente para poder ayudar a su familia con la situación económica que cada día es más difícil.  Con muchos sacrificios ha logrado establecer su propio negocio en el mercado central de la zona donde ella habita en el cual vende variedad de artículos tales como: artículos escolares, artículos de belleza, entre otros. Su negocio está ubicado en un lugar muy transitado y accesible para todos. Hace ya varios años que empezó con este negocio y gracias a Dios ha logrado mantenerlo activo y espera que así sea en el futuro ya que para ella es muy importante porque es uno de  sus principales fuentes de ingresos. Stefany es una mujer muy competitiva y siempre le gusta estar un paso delante de la competencia es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito para invertir en su negocio en la compra de diversos productos como: artículos de  belleza, artículos de librería y de mas artículos que permitan atraer a nuevos clientes que generen un aumento tanto en ventas como en ingresos de tal manera que pueda lograr mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Stefany Elizabeth is 23 years old and she lives in the family home of her parents. Stefany is a young, enterprising woman who is full of dreams. She works very hard to help her family with the financial situation of the house hold, which is more difficult every day. With many sacrifices she has managed to establish her own business in the central market of the region where she lives. There she sells a variety of items such as: school supplies, beauty products, etc. Her business is located in a very well traveled location and it is accessible to all. She started out her business many years ago and Thanks be to God that she has managed to keep it active. She hopes this will continue in the future because for her it is very important and it is one of her principal sources of income. Stefany is a very competitive woman and she always enjoys being one step ahead of the competition. For this reason she has decided to request a loan and to invest it in her business by purchasing a variety of products such as: beauty products, office supplies and other merchandise which will permit her to attract new clients. This will generate an increase in sales and in profits which will result in the improvement of the quality of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as beauty products and office supplies

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
Anacleta works hard to support her family. Anacleta is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Anacleta requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for fishing.

Anacleta has been in this business for 15 years now, and earns additional income from a variety store.

In the future, Anacleta would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment for fishing

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children.
 
Liezl has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Liezl has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Liezl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas de 56 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su grupo familiar el cual lo conforma su compañera de viada y sus hijas. Para tomas lo más importante es su familia la cual es su principal inspiración para luchar día a día por un futuro mejor. Él es un hombre increíble ya que a pesar de su edad  no se cansa de trabajar. Tomas se dedica a realizar viajes tanto de personas como de materiales. Tiene muchos clientes fijos y cada día son más las personas que solicitan su servicio. Para él lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con el servicio que ofrece, razón por la cual siempre está pendiente de tener su vehículo en buenas condiciones. Últimamente ha notado un deterioro de su vehículo ya que uso es constante y necesita mantenimiento. Debido a lo anterior ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en el mantenimiento del vehículo que es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Espera tener resultados positivos de esta decisión y seguir brindando el buen servicio tal y como hasta el momento lo ha hecho. De esta manera confía mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Tomas is 56 years old. He lives in his own house together with his family. It is composed of his life partner and his daughters. For Tomas the more important thing is his family. They are his principal source of inspiration to keep struggling day after day for a better future. He is an incredible man who, despite his age, is a tireless worker. Tomas is a transportation driver for both passengers and for cargo. He has many steady clients and each day there are more people who request his services. The most important thing for him is for his clients to be satisfied with the service he offers. This is the reason why he is always careful to have his vehicle in a good state of repair. Lately he has noticed the deterioration of his vehicle, especially because it is in constant use, and it requires maintenance. For the reason previously mentioned he has decided to request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). He will invest it in the maintenance repairs of his vehicle, which is his primary working tool. He hopes to attain positive results from this decision and to keep providing good services, as he has to date. He trusts he will be able to improve the quality of his life and that of his family.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance repairs to his vehicle

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Jocelyn has a rice field and she harvests and sells rice grains in due time. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. Cristina is married and has a guitar-making business in the Philippines.

Cristina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her guitar-making business.

Cristina has been in this business for 30 years now, and earns additional income from crafting shells.

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her guitar-making business

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Carmelina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 15 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and rice for resale.

Carmelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Carmelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and rice for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rope-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years. Gloria earns more income from food vending.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope making business

loans.name: Vergilia

texts.en:
Vergilia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Vergilia has a coffee shop that sells breads, snacks & serves coffee & milk drinks. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy snacks, beverages & powdered coffee.

Vergilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Vergilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & powdered coffee.

loans.name: Ma. Jessica

texts.en:
Ma. Jessica is 45 years old and married with six children.

Ma. Jessica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, beverages and other groceries to sell.

Ma. Jessica has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for two years and earns additional income from frozen foods.

Ma. Jessica aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, beverages and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Joveta

texts.en:
Joveta is 50 years old and married with four children.

Joveta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Joveta has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 25 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Joveta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 61 years old and lives in the small village of Tinago, Province of Siquijor.  She is married with four children.

Alicia has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for one year.  Each month,  she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 7,000 pesos to purchase stock for her general store.

Alicia has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for nine months.  In the future, Alicia hope to have a savings deposit and able to renovate their house.

loans.use: To purchase  stock for her general store.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Leonida has a "vermi farm" that produces "vermi" waste (worm castings) that can be used as fertilizer. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional "vermi" worms.

Leonida has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Leonida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional "vermi" worms to make fertilizer.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla is 31 years old and married with two children.

Myla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Myla has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Myla aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Filipinas

texts.en:
Filipinas is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad transport.

Filipinas has been in this business for four years. Filipinas earns more income from food vending.

Filipinas has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad transport business

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like blouses, pants, etc. to sell to customers. In the future, Joey would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants, etc. to sell to customers.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda is 59 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sindangan, Zamoboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Daylinda has a business selling roasted pig (lechon baboy)and vending meat. She earns about PHP 14,000 each month doing this type of work. Daylinda has  requested a loan of P5,000 to purchase pigs and ingredients for her roasted pig (leachon baboy) and meat vending business.

Daylinda has been a member of PMPC for two months. In the future, Daylinda would like to improve this business so that she can cater to other places and people.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and ingredients for her roasted pig (leachon baboy) and meat vending.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Emily is buying and peddling fish, like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy fish to sell. Emily has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. 

In the future, Emily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Conchita has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from E-loading. She wants to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married with 2 children. She is 31 years old and lives in Tugas, Baliangao. Elizabeth has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns 4,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase stock for her general store. Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is 43 years old and married with 7 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from food vending. Dulce hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 55 years old and married with 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like sugar and other groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, Francisca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Juanito is providing motorcycle, or habal-habal, services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service. Juanito has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Juanito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Zeporah

texts.en:
Zeporah is 33 years old and married with 6 children. She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. She has been raising chickens for 5 years and also earns additional income from frozen foods.

Zeporah is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and medicines for her chickens. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and medicines for her chickens.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 59 years old and married with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.  Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Jovita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Jovita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jovita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is married with 3 children. She is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. Elsa is a farmer and produces mango fruit to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years and she earns 10,000 PHP a month from this business. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase 100 liters of spray fertilizer for mangoes. Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase 100 liters of spray fertilizer for mangoes

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a live fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for a year.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more feed for her fish. Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more feed for her fish.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a shell crafts business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her shell crafts business. In the future, Angelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell crafts business

loans.name: Bebeth

texts.en:
Bebeth works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. Bebeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Rosalia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rosalia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma, a 46-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom attend school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been operating a food stall selling frozen foods in the Philippines for the past two years, and is now requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a variety store business in the Philippines.

Clementina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store. She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Clementina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a rope-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 8 years. She earns more income from fish vending.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Gina works hard to support her family. She has been selling assorted biscuits in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Gina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more assorted biscuits to sell to customers.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en:
Georgette is married with 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Georgette is 52 years old and has 5 children who are in school.

Georgette has a room rental business in the Philippines. Georgette requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for the upkeep of the rental rooms.

Georgette has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Georgette would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for  the upkeep of the rental rooms.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
As a married mother of 6 children, Luciana works hard to support her family. She has selling fruit and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. Luciana is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Luciana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rope-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business.

Josephine has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from food vending.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Merlita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Merlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married with two children. Mary Ann is 32 years old and lives in Tugas, Baliangao.

Mary Ann sells grocery items to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns 6,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 30,000 PHP to purchase 20 boxes of assorted grocery items and beverages.

Mary Ann has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase 20 boxes of assorted grocery items and beverages.

loans.name: Rasheeda Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Rasheeda bibi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her grocery store business. She has been involved in this business for past eight years. In these years, she has earned a good reputation among her clients for her good behavior and quality products.  

With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk to sell in her store. 

Rasheeda has a son who is a daily wage labor. Her husband is a mason and constructs buildings.  

She is hopeful that after the loan investment her business will improve further and as a result her family will be able to live a better standard of life.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rasheeda bibi.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Mr. Kang is 42 years old. He cultivates rice crops in a suburban area outside of Phnom Penh city. He lives with his wife, who works in a garment factory, and five children. Mr. Kang is a diligent person. Through his effort, he hopes to support the education of his children because he wants to see them become well-educated and helpful people. Through farming, he usually earns around 2 USD per day for the family’s financial needs. Mr. Kang has applied for a loan of 400 USD to buy cows that can be used to plow his farmland. This loan will help increase the income of the family.

In the future, Mr. Kang expects to grow his farming business more successfully. With the increase in income he will make, he wants to fix his present house and save it for his children’s future.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish farm in the Philippines.

Lilian requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and feeds.

Lilian has been in this business for one year.

Lilian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and feeds.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 41 years old and is married with two children.

Leonida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like sugar and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Leonida has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Leonida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Merlin

texts.en:
Merlin is married and has six children, five of whom are in school. Merlin, who is 40 years old, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Merlin has a rope-making business in the Philippines. Merlin requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business.

Merlin has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Merlin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi works hard to support her family. Noemi is married and sells bananas in the Philippines.

Noemi requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy bananas to sell in her food stall.

Noemi has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Noemi would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Rose Mae Ann

texts.en:
Rose Mae Ann works hard to support her family. Rose Mae Ann is married and has a shell-crafts business in the Philippines.

Rose Mae Ann requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like nylon, shells, etc. for her shell-crafts business.

Rose Mae Ann has been in this business for four years now, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.

In the future, Rose Mae Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like nylon, shells, etc. for her shell-crafts business.

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud is 67 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. Salud has a shop where she sells cosmetics. She has had this business for 15 years. She earns 8,000 PHP a month. She requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase skin-care creams, lotions, powders, perfumes, lipsticks, fingernail and toe nail polish, eye and facial makeup, and towelettes.

Salud has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Salud hopes to have a big cosmetics store.

loans.use: to purchase skin-care creams, lotions, powders, perfumes, lipsticks, etc.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is 56 years old, married, and has four children. She is a seaweed farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. Viviana also sells fish at the market. She buys directly from fishermen in her town. Viviana works hard to support her family.

Viviana has requested a loan to buy straw and wooden pegs for seaweed farming, as well as more fish to sell. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy straw, wooden pegs, and fish

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
At her age of 51, Elizabeth still works hard to improve her family's living conditions. She enjoys her daily routine in her retail store. She operates her business in front of her house. Elizabeth sells food and daily-use products, such as soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar, and milk. She had been managing her business for almost three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. 

She has seven children. Four of them are married and live on their own. The rest of her children attend school and have daily needs.

Elizabeth is now asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, bread, eggs, instant noodles, coffee, and sugar. She needs to stock more grocery items in her store to increase her sales. 

In the future, she wants to establish a larger store to meet all her customers' demands for high-quality products. She wants to immediately get the attention of people in her neighborhood who might need an item such as a sachet of shampoo.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, bread, eggs, instant noodles, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. Lorna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Gazelle

texts.en:
Gazelle is 30 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in the Philippines. 
 
Gazelle has a shop where she buys and sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for three years. 

Gazelle is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of used clothing.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gazelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of used clothing.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 53 years old and  married. He has been living and working in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He comes from a big family. 

Sok and his wife are involved in cultivating rice for their livelihood. They work on their inherited farm. Together, they typically earn about $7.50 per day to support their living and household expenses. 

Sok is requesting a loan from HKL,  a Kiva partner, which he will use to pay laborers harvesting his rice crops. In the future, he wishes to expand his farmland and generate more rice production in order to raise his family from poverty.

loans.use: to pay for laborers harvesting his rice crops.

loans.name: Domenador

texts.en:
Domenador is 47 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in Upper Loboc,Oroquieta City. 
 
Domenador has a fishing business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He is requesting a loan for  5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase materials for fishing. Domenador has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase materials for fishing.

loans.name: Petivia

texts.en:
Petivia is 33 years old, married, and has four children. She owns and operates a business, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has been in this business for two years.  

Petivia is requesting a loan for 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profits from her business, estimated to be 200 talas or $83 per week, to improve and expand her business.

Petivia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Petivia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers.

loans.name: Simealai

texts.en:
Simealai is 54 years old. She is married and has three children. Simealai owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has 6 years of experience in this business.
 
Simealai needs a loan of 2,700 WST to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2007 Simealai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Simealai's seventh loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Suesa

texts.en:
Suesa is 56 years old. She is married and has two children. Suesa owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 5 years of experience in this business. 
 
Suesa needs a loan of 2,500 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Suesa joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Suesa's eighth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Fetalai

texts.en:
Fetalai is 38 years old. She is married and has five children. Fetalai owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 5 years of experience in this business.  

Fetalai needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Fetalai joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Fetalai's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 36 year old, single, and has two children, one of whom attends school and one of whom works in a garment factory and earns $4 per day.

Pov is a cake seller earning $3 per day. Every month she has to spend $40 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

Pov is requesting a loan for $200, which she will use to buy wood to repair her house. She wants to extend her career of selling cakes when she can service more customers.

loans.use: to purchase wood for repairing her house

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is a 19-year-old single lady with no children. Ruta owns and operates a business venture, catching and selling ocean-caught fish.  She has one year of experience in this business. 
 
Ruta needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase fishing nets and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Ruta joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks.  This is Ruta's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and fishing equipment.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, 41 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a village chief who earns $5 per day. They have three children. One is studying and two are working, earning $10 per day in all. 

Every month Phally has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

Phally would like to request a loan of $400 to buy a motorbike for her husband so he can travel to work. She doesn’t have any plans yet for a career because she doesn’t have enough money.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Harn

texts.en:
Harn is a 45-year-old farmer who earns $2 per day. She is a single mother and lives with her two children. All are working in a garment factory and each earns $3 per day. Every month she has to spend $79 on food and $10 on other expenses.
 
Harn would like to request a loan of $600 to buy two oxen for doing farming. This loan would help her because she wouldn’t have to spend money to rent a villager’s oxen to plow her field. She doesn’t want to change her career because she doesn’t know what else she can do besides farming.

loans.use: to buy two oxen for doing farming.

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is a housewife and the mother of four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. Surriya stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She is a very active and cooperative person by nature.
  
Her husband operates a grocery store in the community. Through his store, he sells everyday household items like spices, sugar, rice, lentils, etc. for reasonable rates to his customers.

Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With this loan, her husband will buy groceries in bulk to be able to sell in his store. This will help him make better sales and earn better profits.
 
Surriya hopes that the investment will be a productive one for her husband and will improve the standard of living for her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Tierm

texts.en:
Tierm, 28 years old, works in a garment factory and earns $3 per day. Her husband provides a horse cart service and earns $2.50 per day. They have a 5-year-old child.  

Every month Tierm has to spend $77 on food, $10 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

Tierm would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work and for other uses in the family. She wants to repair her house to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Нурали проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он имеет высшее медицинское образование. Нурали занимается торговлей медикаментов. У него имеется аптека в районе. В этой области он три года. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимых медикаментов.
texts.en: Nurali lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 42 years old, married and has five children.  He has a higher medical education.  Nurali is involved in sales of pharmaceuticals.  He has a pharmacy in the district.  He has been in this field for three years.  Nurali is requesting this loan for the purchase of necessary pharmaceutical products.

loans.use: to purchase necessary pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Load

texts.en: Load is a farmer and earns $5 per day. Her husband is a carpenter at home.  He earns $10 per day. They have one child, 2 years old. Every month, Load has to spend $60 on food, and $15 on other expenses. She would like a loan of $1000 to buy construction materials and to hire a worker to rebuild her house. This loan will help her husband with a bigger space for his work.

loans.use: To buy construction material and a hire worker to rebuild her house

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget, 33, is a farmer who resides in Kompot province, a good agricultural zone. She has a life partner in her husband, Mr. Hy, who works as a fisherman. Her husband regularly catches fish, crabs and other sea animals from the sea nearby and then brings them to sell in a market. Together, they normally earn an average of $4USD each day to cover all the expenses. They are blessed with three young children who are attending a local public school.
Mrs. Nget is seeking a loan from HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, to buy a motorcycle for the use of the family. This loan will help facilitate her family's comfortable living and reduce some expenses on transportation fees.
In the future, Mrs. Nget hopes she’ll be able to expand her family’s business and to support all her children to the university level in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a widow and a mother of four children: one daughter and three sons. Her daughter is in the 10th standard while her elder son has passed his 10th standard recently. Her youngest son reads in the 5th standard. 
Her husband was a driver and provided transport services to passengers. Two years before his death he purchased a rickshaw, which he drove to generate income.  The earning responsibility came down on her elder son's shoulders. He drives his father's rickshaw and continues his business to generate income for the family. 
Currently, the rickshaw needs repair work.  Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah.  With the loan, her son will fully repair the rickshaw so he can drive it without any problems and will earn a good income as well.  Shahnaz is hopeful that her son's financial position will be improved after the loan investment.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Arman Junio

texts.en:
Arman is married and has 5 children. Arman is 39 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  He owns and manages his own bakery to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, he earns PHP 12,000 doing this work. He has requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase bread flour and other bread making ingredients.
 
Arman has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Arman hopes to improve and expand his business so that he can have bakeries in other barangays (villages). He plan to have branch.

loans.use: to purchase bread flour and other bread making ingredients.

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.ru: Мукарам жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 30 лет. Она не замужем. У нее среднее образование. Мукарам уже два года как занимается торговлей.  Она у себя дома продает полотенце, мужское и женское нижнее белье, носовые платки и носки. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Mukaram lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  She is 30 years old and single.  She has a secondary education.  Mukaram has been involved in retail sales for two years.  She sells towels, men's and women's undergarments, handkerchiefs and socks at home.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise in order to expand the assortment of her goods.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Saeeda Bano's Group

texts.en:
Saeeda bano has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. Her husband is involved in the business of selling wheat & corn. He buys these products from farmers and earns good profits by selling to different dealers. 
He has been in this profession for the past four years. With the loan, he will buy wheat & corn in bulk to be able to fulfill orders on time and earn maximum profits. 
Saeeda herself, is a caring wife and a mother. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she also does sewing to supplement the income for her family. She has three daughters and a son. Her eldest daughter is married and the next helps Saeeda in managing the household chores. The youngest one reads in 2nd standard, while her son reads in the 6th standard. 
She is hopeful that her husband’s business will be improved further after the loan investment and her family will be able to enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy wheat & corn for selling

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.ru: Баргигул проживает в районе Дангара. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. Ее старший сын находится на заработках в России, второй сын помогает ей в торговле, а третий учится в средней школе. Сама Баргигул занимается торговлей. Она продает детскую и женскую одежду. В этой области шесть лет. Кредит берет для приобретения теплой детской одежды и зимней обуви.
texts.en: Bargigul lives in the Dangara district.  She is 53 years old, married and has three children.  Her oldest son is working in Russia, second son helps her with the sales, and the third attends a secondary school.  Bargigul is involved in sales.  She sells children's and women's clothing.  She has been in this business for six years.  Bargigul is requesting this loan for the purchase of warm children's clothing and winter shoes.

loans.use: to purchase warm children's clothing and winter shoes

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng is 27 years old and married.  She is from Baray, Kompong Thom province. 

Kheng has been raising pigs for both meat and offspring, which she has been doing for over five years. She built a piggery where she raises her pig behind her house.  After raising them for about four months, she sells her pigs to tradesmen who kill them for meat. She earns about $1.50 per day. 

Presently, her family does not have a motorcycle. When they want to go somewhere, they have to pay for a motor taxi service. In order to solve this problem, Kheng is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle. In the future, she plans to create a new business by selling mixed products in her community. In addition, she wishes to fix some broken parts of her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children: four are still attending school, one has already finished, and the other is still too young for school. Fatuma's husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. They have a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Fatuma's greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Fatuma has operated a goat-selling business for the past year. Her potential clients are the people at the market. Transporting her goats to the market for sale is one of the major challenges she faces. She dreams of expanding her business and selling cattle as well.

With the loan of 40,000 KES, Fatuma wants to purchase more goats to sell. She decided to join Yehu because it cares about its clients' welfare.

loans.use: to purchase goats for sale.

loans.name: Avliyokul

texts.ru: Авлиёкул проживает в районе Дангара. Возраст, 35 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Двое его детей учатся в школе, а другой маленький. Сам Авлиёкул занимается торговлей на рынке. Он занимается продажей занавесей и тканей. Этим видом деятельности занимается 13 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он хочет купить несколько рулонов однотонные тканей.
texts.en: Avliyokul lives in the Dangara district.  He is 35 years old, married and has three children.  Two of his children attend a school, and the other one is still very small.  Avliyokul is involved in sales at the market.  He sells drapes and fabrics.  He has been in this business for 13 years.  Avliyokul is requesting this loan to increase goods turnover.  He wants to buy several rolls of solid-color fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase solid-color fabrics

loans.name: Zeenat's Group

texts.en:
Zeenat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s scrap business. With the loan, her husband will buy scrap, like plastic bottles, used papers, etc., in order to increase his sales and profits. Zeenat's husband has been operating his business for the past 10 years and handles a good clientele base.  

Zeenat is a mother of three sons and a daughter. Her elder son is illiterate and does not work, while her younger son does work with his father. The youngest works in a motor workshop. Her daughter reads in 8th standard. 

Zeenat herself is a talented lady who operates a sewing business at her home to supplement the income for her family. She receives orders from her community clients and earns a good income by completing them on time. 

Zeenat is confident that the investment will take her husband's business to a more profitable position and improve the living standard of her family as a result.

loans.use: to buy scrap for her husband's scrap business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Gina owns a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Jeanliyn

texts.en:
Jeanliyn is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jeanliyn has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands (food items) like adobo and pancit bihon. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for making the food she sells.

Jeanliyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jeanliyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell.

loans.name: Jackelyn

texts.en:
Jackelyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jackelyn has a junk shop that buys and sells recycled materials like bottles, plastic wares, and metals. She has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy recycled materials like bottles, plastics, and metals to sell in her shop.

Jackelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like bottles, plastics, and metals to sell.

loans.name: Ranogul

texts.ru: Раъногул жительница района Дангары. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем. Имеет четверых детей. Она занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Она  в основном закупает скот, откармливает и через некоторое время продает по более выгодной цене. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа двух коров и теленка.
texts.en: Ranogul lives in the Dangara district.  She is 43 years old, married and has four children.  She is involved in breeding cattle.  She primarily buys livestock, fattens it up and sells it at a more profitable price after a certain period of time.  Ranogul has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of two cows and a calf.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and a calf

loans.name: Lonie

texts.en:
Lonie is single. Lonie is 30 years of age and he lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Lonie owns a shop to earn a living; he's had this business for five years. Each month, he earns 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase and add more materials to his shop.

Lonie has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Lonie hopes to expand his business as well as he can to have a good future.

loans.use: to purchase and add more materials to his shop.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Carmela has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Carmela has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Carmela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Khursheed Begum's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed Begum is married with four children. Her elder son reads in 5th standard, while her younger son is in 4th standard. Her elder daughter is in 3rd standard and her youngest one is in class one. 

Khurhseed is a caring lady by nature. She gets up early in the morning, readies her kids for school and prepares breakfast for her family, then cleans the whole house. After finishing the household work, she does sewing work to fulfill orders on time. She manages both jobs very efficiently.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy another sewing machine for expanding her business further. She will hire an assistant as well, which will help her with getting good orders and earning a better income. 

She is confident that through the loan investment, she will take her business to a more profitable position.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for a sewing business.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хаким трудолюбивый и ответственный. Он женат у него 5 детей. Хаким  занимается дехканским делом более 6 лет. Он занимается выращиванием таких овощей как лук, картошка, морковь и др. Хаким имеет большой опыт в этом деле. На участке он выращивает экологически  чистые и качественные  продукты, благодаря чему его продукты всегда имеют спрос среди клиентов. Хаким хочет получить займ на сумму 6500 сомони для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений. Эти средства помогут повысить урожайность и избавиться от вредных насекомых. Надеясь на вашу поддержку он выражает вам свою признательность.
texts.en: Hakim is a hardworking and responsible person.  He is married and has five children.  Hakim is involved in a dekhan (farming) business for over six years.  He grows vegetables, such as onions, potatoes, carrots and others.  Hakim has an extensive experience in this business.  He grows ecologically clean and quality products on his land, and, thanks to this, his products are always in high demand among customers.  Hakim wants to obtain a loan in the sum 6500 somoni for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.  These means will help him increase harvestability and eliminate harmful insects.  Hoping to get your support, Hakim expresses his gratitude to you.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Raquel has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON.

Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Elsie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Elsie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elsie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 26 лет. Она вдова. У нее двое детей. Ее дети маленькие. Заррина предоставляет услугу. Она арендует помещение на рынке, где открыла столовую. В этой области она уже год. Кредит берет для приобретения продуктов, чтобы приготовить новые блюда и тем самым составить меню.
texts.en: Zarina lives in the Dangara Region. She is 26 years old. She is a widow. She has two children. Her children are still very young.  Zarina is in food service. She rents space at the market where she opened a cafeteria. She has been in this business for a year. She is taking out a loan in order to buy food products for her menu.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with two children one of whom attends school while the other one is too young for school. He has a house with electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his child. 

He has operated a fuel selling business for the past one year; his potential clients are his neighbors and motor cycles operators. He faces a major challenge of bad debts where his customers refuse to pay there debts in time. He dreams of owning a big farm in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000 he wants to purchase more liters of fuel for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase more liters of fuel for resale.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Eleuteria has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 31 years. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

Eleuteria has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.ru: Чамшеду  32 года, он женат, имеет 4 детей. 15 лет он работает в сфере общественного питания. Чамшед мастер своего дела. В этом бизнесе он работает самостоятельно. Чамшед готовит  и продает национальные блюда в столовой. Там у него всегда  чисто и многие клиенты ценят это и хорошо отзываются  о его кухне. Чамшед хочет получить кредит на сумму $3000 США для  пополнения оборота. Получив займ он сможет развить бизнес, что принесет пользу и семейному бюджету.
texts.en: Chamshed is 32 years old, married and has four children.  He has been working in the public food field for 15 years.  Chamshed is a master of his craft and works in this business independently.  Chamshed cooks and sells national dishes at a cafe.  It is always clean there, and many customers value this and give good feedback about his kitchen.  Chamshed wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 to increase his revolving capital.  Having obtained the loan, he would be able to develop his business, which will bring a benefit to the family budget as well.

loans.use: to buy additional dishware and expand business space

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Lucia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell in her store.

Lucia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Nenita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She also provides karaoke services, for which the customers pay 5 pesos per song. Nenita has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods and snacks for the store and to pay for the electricity for the karaoke.

Nenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and snacks for her store and pay for the electricity for her karaoke service.

loans.name: Sedrack

texts.en: Sedrack is a thirty-one-year-old hardworking married man with five children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His goal for his family is to build a permanent house and educate his children. Sedrack has been selling goats for five years, which has enabled him to provide the basics for his family. His dream is to own a ranch. Sedrack's challenge has been that he lacks enough capital to meet the demand. He needs the loan to buy goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 42-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and one sibling. She suffers from a paralysis in her legs. Even so, she has been selling women's accessories and dressmaking supplies since 2007. She also works as a tailor, sewing clothes and repairing the damaged ones. Today, she is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added merchandise for her shop in order to strengthen her business and gain more income. This will be her fourth Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал возраст 27 лет, холост. У Амала дилерский центр, который находится в центре города. Он занимается этим делом 3 года и имеет опыт работы. Рядом с его центром много госучреждений и других объектов, поэтому  у него в дилерском  центре всегда многолюдно. Его работа всегда востребована. Он хочет получить займ на сумму $3000 США  для покупки компьютера и расширения бизнеса. Акмал надеясь на вашу поддержку, заранее благодарит вас за помощь.
texts.en: Akmal is 27 years old, single.  He has a dealer center, located in the town center.  He has been involved in this business for three years and has work experience.  It is always crowded in his dealer center because there are many government offices and other sites near his center.  His work is always in demand.  Akmal wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 to purchase a computer and expand his business.  Akmal relies on your support and thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and expand his business

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children.
