Amos has a pigpen from which he sells matured & grown pigs. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Amos has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Amos hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Boymurod

texts.ru: Боймурод житель района Дж. Руми. Возраст, 54 года. Он женат. Имеет пятерых детей. У него высшее образование. Он окончил Таджикский аграрный Университет. На сегодняшний день Боймурод зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Boymurod lives in the J.Rumy district.  He is 54 years old, married and has five children.  He has a higher education and graduated from the Tajik Agricultural University.  Today, Boymurod earns a living by breeding cattle.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of several heads of bulls.

loans.use: to buy several heads of bulls

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with two children. Veronica is 43 years old and she lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Veronica manages an internet cafe to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase and add more computers to her business. Veronica has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Veronica hopes to improve her small business.


About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase more computers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria Tumolba is from the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 28 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Gloria has been selling different kinds of fish in the local community for almost 20 years and earns approximately PHP 800 daily.

According to Gloria, through the income generated from her business she has been able to give daily allowances to her children in school. Now, she wants to take a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase different kinds of fish, such as tilapia and milkfish to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish to sell

loans.name: Gladys Ann

texts.en:
Gladys Ann is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Gladys Ann has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy fish to sell.

Gladys Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gladys Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for resale

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Vivian has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON.

Vivian has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vivian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Georgina Carpentero Group

texts.en:
Georgina is married with four children. Georgina is 36 years old and lives in Mahayag.

To earn a living, Georgina has a boarding house business near the school. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 7,000. Georgina has been a member of PMPC for two years. Georgina is the leader of a five-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a married woman with one child. She lives in the town of Talibon with her family. Vilma has been in the hog-raising business for five years. She works hard to support her husband in providing for their needs and sending their child to school. Vilma plans to use her loan to purchase pig feeds and materials for piggery construction. Vilma hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and materials for piggery construction

loans.name: Sarah May

texts.en:
Sarah May is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Sarah May has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON.

Sarah May has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Sarah May hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson wants a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. He is a 32-year-old father of two children and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a mechanic and has been in service for seven years. He faces a problem of delayed payments and his dream is to own a full-fledged garage.

Jackson intends to use the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
A talented lady, Allah rakhi owns & operates a sewing business at her home to financially contribute to the family. She sews clothes by taking orders from her community clients. She charges PKR 150 for each dress and her clients don’t argue on the amount because of the quality of her work. 

Her husband is a salesman by profession. He sells energy savers (a kind of bulb) to different stores and earns income for the family. He buys energy savers at wholesale. He has been in this profession for the past three years and handles a good clientele base.
 
Allah rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy energy savers in bulk to be able to improve his sales and generate a good income.
 
She is hopeful that the loan investment will be profitable for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy energy savers (a kind of bulb) to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce wants a loan to buy new clothes and materials for resale. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She started with one sewing machine nine years ago which she would use for tailoring and as of today she owns a retail shop for new clothes. She dreams of constructing a commercial house and stocking all types of ladies and children's wear.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and materials for resale

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Evangeline has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 48 years old, married, and has three children. They live in the village where she sells fish while her husband manages their fields. He also helps her with selling fish in the local community. She uses her income to pay the electric bill and for her family's daily needs. 

Due to the high cost of basic commodities, Delia is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase fish such as milkfish and tilapia to sell.

 Delia hopes to increase her profits so that she can meet the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. She believes that through her patience in managing her business she will be able to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fish such as milkfish and tilapia to sell

loans.name: Manuelito

texts.en:
Manuelito is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children. 

Manuelito is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service. 

Manuelito has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Manuelito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is 58 years old and married. He is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. Jorge operates a fishing boat to catch fish. He and his wife work together to sell his catch at the market. Jorge works hard to improve his business and his family's living conditions. He requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and repair his pump boat. This will help Jorge continue earning money from his business.

In the future, Jorge hopes to have another source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and repair his pump boat

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is a 36-year-old married Lebanese man living with his wife and three children. He has more than 20 years of experience working as a car blacksmith. He is specialized in repairing car bodies. His is the main source of income for the family. 

Today he is asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase special machinery. This will be his second Kiva loan and he is asking for a higher amount because he states that such sum will help him meet his business needs in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase special machinery

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 64 years old and lives in Dulapo, Oroquieta City. She is widowed with three children. 

Venus has a general store and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase stock for her general store. 

Venus has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vinegar, bread, eggs, sugar, and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Allyssa

texts.en:
Allyssa is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Allyssa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Allyssa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Allyssa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Gulzamon

texts.ru: Гулзамон жительница района Кубодиен. Она замужем. Ей 51 год. У нее шестеро детей.  Ее сын находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. Сама она уже пять лет как занимается торговлей. На сегодняшний день она арендует помещение, где открыла продуктовый магазин. Она берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара. Она хочет купить продукты питания и приобрести мужскую и детскую одежду для торговли.
texts.en: Gulzamon lives in the Qubodiyon district.  She is 51 years old, married and has six children.  Her son is working in the Russian Federation.  Gulzamon has been involved in sales for five years.  Today, she leases a space, where she opened a food store.  She is requesting this loan to expand the assortment of products.  Gulzamon wants to buy food products and buy men's and children's clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy food products and men's and children's clothing

loans.name: Matlubakhon

texts.ru: Матлубахон умная, перспективная молодая предпринимательница. Она самостоятельно 6 лет занимается  этой предпринимательской деятельностью и имеет опыт в этом деле. Начинала она бизнес с $2500 США, а сейчас у нее товар на сумму $5000 США. У Матлубахон в ассортименте качественные парфюмерии и товары для женщин, которые очень востребованы. Она имеет репутацию честной, ответственной редпринимательницы. Матлубахон  хочет получить займ на сумму $3000 США для покупки товара и расширения бизнеса. Матлубахон надеясь на вашу поддержку выражает свою признательность.
texts.en: Matlubakhon is a smart, promising young entrepreneur.  She has been running this entrepreneurship independently for six years and has experience in this business.  She started the business with $2500, and now her merchandise is valued at $5000.  Matlubakhon has a selection of quality perfumes and women's goods that are in high demand.  She has a reputation of an honest and responsible entrepreneur.  Matlubakhon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of goods and business expansion.  Matlubakhon hopes to receive your support and expresses her gratitude.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and gift sets

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 47 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is married and has 10 children. 

To earn a living, Nida has a grocery business selling such things as beverages, canned goods, cigarettes, noodles, etc. She earns about 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. 

Nida has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase stock for her grocery store. Nida has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Renato has a vegetable garden. He harvests & sells sayote, stringbeans & upo. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden. Renato has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Renato hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden

loans.name: Meoun

texts.en: Meoun is a farmer and pig feeder who earns $7 per day. Her husband sells palm products earns $4 per day. This couple has two children, six and two  years old. Neither of them are in school yet. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy wood for repairing her house. This loan helps her family to have a better house to live in and can enlarge a place for feeding the pigs. She plans to buy and resell palm sugar in front of her house.

loans.use: To buy wood for repairing her house

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. is from the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 36 years old. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Theresa sells different kinds of fish to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 250 PHP a day for these activities.

At this time, Theresa wants to borrow PHP 7,000 to purchase different kinds of fish, such as tilapia, bighead and milkfish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to pay for their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish to sell

loans.name: Naseem Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Naseem bibi is married with four children: one daughter and three sons. All of them are getting their education. Naseem herself is a housewife who stays at home and manages the household work. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

Her husband is involved in the sofa making business. He makes sofas on order and earns income for the family. He has been in this business for many years. His experience in his field helps him get good orders from his clients. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy foam, thread & cloth in bulk to be able to fulfill orders on time and earn maximum profits. She is hopeful that an investment will prove beneficial for her husband.

loans.use: To buy foam, thread & cloth in bulk

loans.name: Sarem

texts.en: Sarem, 58 years old, is a food seller who earns $5 per day. Her husband runs a battery recharging business and earns $6 per day. They have two children, both of them working and earning $7 per day for both. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to pay the administration fee for her son to work in Thailand. Her husband plans to extend his business to be more modern than before. She plans to support her two children to study in Korea so that they can go to work there because they can make a better salary than in Cambodia and Thailand.

loans.use: To pay the administration fee for her son to work in Thailand

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Michelle has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years.

Michelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Michelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay, 30 years old, is a farmer and pig feeder who earns $7 per day. Her husband sells palm products and earns $4 per day. They have one child who is not yet ready to go to school. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a hand tractor for doing farming. She wants to buy more pigs to feed and make the pigpen bigger than before. She wants to repair her house to be better than before.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor for doing farming

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jesusa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Jesusa has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jesusa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than, 25 years old, is a farmer and pig feeder who earns $4 per day. Her husband sells palm products and earns $10 per day. They have one child who is not yet ready to go to school. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a hand tractor for doing farming.  The hand tractor can help her to do farming and transport sugar to sell in the market and to her customers. She has plans to buy a stock of sugar to sell when the price is good.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor for doing farming

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Rosalinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a married Kenyan lady, age 32 years old. Her husband is a businessman. They have 6 children, ages ranging from 4 to 17 years old, whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. Millicent's business is located in a busy market at a residential area in Nairobi. She has been selling clothes for 6 years. She says the business is good and the challenges she has are those of seasonality and high cost of clothes. In the future, Millicent hopes to open another stall. She describes herself as aggressive and responsible.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock her store business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 34 years old and lives in Canubay,Oroquieta City. She is married with 1 child. 

Fe has a snack vending business and earns approximately 1,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her snack vending business. Fe has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. She is a MIGS member of PMPC.

In the future, Fe hopes to have a large amount of capital to build a new house and own a grocery store. Fe has a happy family. She is a loving wife and takes good care of her only daughter.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her snack vending business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia's main source of income comes from selling fish in the local community. She is 52 years old, widowed and has 7 adult children. She is from the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan, Isabela. Lucia has been in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 800 PHP a day for these activities.

Lucia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lucia is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase different kinds of fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish to sell

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 3 children, aged 14, 12, and 7.  Adelfa is engaged in fishing and farming. She works with her husband in selling the fish at their town's market. They also till a parcel of land where they grow rice crops.

Adelfa has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, nylon and lead. This loan will help Adelfa's family continue earning from their business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, nylon and lead

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin, 45 years old, is a pig feeder and earns $1 per day. Her husband is a fisherman and earns $2 per day. They have six children, two of whom are studying and the other four of whom are working.   Each earns $3 per day.  Every month, Rin has to spend $66; $5 on electricity, $15 on rent house fee, $10 on school fee, $15 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a boat and fishing equipment. Before, she went fishing with her husband but the benefits are not good.  She decided to feed pigs at home in order to make other income.

loans.use: To buy a boat and fishing equipment

loans.name: Phi

texts.en:
Farming is a popular work for most of Cambodian people who live in the countryside. Mrs. Phi, 48, is a resident of Ornlong Veng, Siem Reap province, cultivating crops for her livelihood. She grows potatoes, some kinds of beans and rice. There is alot of work to do during the rainy season, but even so, her husband always works alongside her on the farm. This humble couple is able to earn around $8USD per day through their business.  They have four children who live under their care and attend school. 
With this loan, Mrs. Phi will purchase a few sacks of fertilizer and pesticides to make her plants grow well. In the future, she hopes she’ll able to expand her farmland and buy a plowing machine to use instead of animals’ strength.

loans.use: to purchase a few sacks of fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 6 children.  Alberta has a food shop that sells hot cakes, cheesecakes, & rice cakes. She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell. 
Alberta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Alberta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell

loans.name: Еrkinjon

texts.ru: Эркинджон трудолюбивый и ответственный. У него крепкая и дружная семья, жена и 2 детей. Он  уже 11 лет занимается в сфере транспортных услуг. Эркинджон перевозит пассажиров с одного города на другой.  У него много постоянных клиентов, которые обращаются к нему за помощью. Он очень  отзывчивый, поэтому имеет хорошую репутацию. Эркинджон хочет получить займ на сумму 1000$ США для ремонта своей автомашины, впереди зима и он хочет подготовить машину к зимним условиям. Он очень надеется на вашу поддержку и благодарит вас заранее за понимание.
texts.en: Еrkinjon is a hard-working and responsible person.  He has a strong and friendly family - a wife and two children.  He has been involved in the transportation field for 11 years.  Еrkinjon transports passengers from one town to another.  He has many loyal customers, who come to him for help.  He is very responsive and that is why he has a good reputation.  Еrkinjon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 to repair his car and prepare it for the winter conditions.  He relies on your support and thanks you in advance for your understanding.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom, 54 years old, is a vegetable seller who earns $2 per day. Her husband is a worker who earns $1 per day. They have four children, one of whom is studying and the other three of whom are working.  Each earns $2 per day. Every month, Mom has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like a loan of $600 to buy vegetables and corn to sell in the market. Her business can make a profit that can support the family. She wants to buy more vegetables to sell so she can make better profits.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and corn to sell in the market

loans.name: Daisy Jane

texts.en:
Daisy Jane is single, 25 years old,and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Daisy Jane manages an internet cafe to earn a living and had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to acquire additional one set of computer for her internet cafe.Daisy Jane internet cafe helps the students of there villages for research.

Daisy Jane has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Daisy Jane hopes to expand her business for her future family that is coming over soon. She want also to have a big space for her internet cafe, she is savings for the renovation and with the help of GDMPC.

loans.use: to purchase one set of computers for her internet cafe

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 46 years old and lives in Tipan, Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Marlyn has a business selling items such as vegetable oil, sugar, Nescafé, Milo, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. She earns about 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Marlyn has a requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase a variety of products for her general store.

Marlyn has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for her general store.

loans.name: Siddiqan's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqan is a 49-year-old married lady. She owns and operates a sewing business at her home. She sews clothes to supplement the income of her family. Her sewing quality is very famous among her clients, and her clients refer many other clients to her. In this way, she handles a good clientele base. 

To fulfill the orders on time, her elder daughter also supports her. She reads in 8th standard, and after coming back from school, she gives time for sewing. Of her remaining children -- three sons and two daughters -- her eldest son works with his father in his ice-block business; the next to him works in a factory, while her other children are getting an education.  

Siddiqan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy ice blocks to sell to his customers. She is hopeful that the loan investment will be a profitable one for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy ice blocks for selling.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for five years. Noemi has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of used clothing to sell. In the future, Noemi hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Shokir

texts.ru: Шокир возраст 48 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. У него собственная  грузовая машина. Он 10 лет занимается перевозкой грузов на  КАМАЗ - е с одного региона на другой. Шокир водитель со стажем. Он очень любит свою профессию. Шокир заботливый отец он хочет вырастить детей в хороших условиях и поэтому большее время проводит за рулем машины, он знает, что машина это средство заработки и регулярно ремонтирует ее. Шокир  хотел бы получить займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки запчастей авто, это покупка поможет ему в бизнесе и принесет прибыль и семейному бюджету
texts.en: Shokir is 48 years old, married and has four children.  He has his own truck.  Shokir has been involved in transporting loads on the Kamaz truck from one region to another.  He is a driver with experience.  He loves his profession very much.  Shokir is a caring father and wants to raise his children in good conditions.  This is why he spends the majority of time behind the truck wheel and knows that the truck is a source of income that has to be repaired regularly.  Shokir wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10,000 somoni to purchase spare auto parts.  This purchase will help him in the business and will benefit the family budget.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fodder for the animals and added merchandise needed

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Romelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years.She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
 
Romelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Romelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jemelia

texts.en:
Jemelia is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jemelia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages and dried fish. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
 
Jemelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Jemelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph has owned a car repair shop since 1990. His job consists of repairing vehicles from the outside. He is a 50-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and four children. Because of his older age, Joseph had to hire a full-time employee to help him accomplish the work tasks. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new mechanical equipment. He is certain that the loan will help him achieve remarkable growth in his business, which will return higher profits to him.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanical equipment

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with 10 children, five of whom attend school while the others are through with their studies. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He has a house with electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Suleiman has operated a carpentry shop for the past 15 years; his potential clients are Kwale area residents. He faces a major challenge of expensive timber due to the tree-cutting ban. He dreams of having the best timber shop in Kwale.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase timber, nails and vanish for his business. He decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase timber, nails and vanish for his business.

loans.name: Sesinia

texts.en:
Sesinia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Sesinia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 22 years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 
Sesinia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Sesinia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хаким  возраст 57 лет.  У Хакима большая семья, сын которого женил, живет с ними, жена работая медсестрой получает маленькую зарплату. Он имеет  собственную столовую где готовит вкусные шашлыки. В бизнесе ему помогает сын.  Эта столовая находится в центре города, у него много клиентов, потому  он готовит вкусные и отменные шашлыки, бизнес приносит хорошую прибыль. Хакиму нужно женить второго сына, но пока для него нет отдельного дома и денег на строительство мало, поэтому он хотел бы получить займ на сумму 10000 сомони и обещает в срок погасить. Хаким надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Hakim is 57 years old.  He has a large family - a son, who just got married, lives with them, and wife, who is a nurse, earns a small salary.  Hakim has his own cafe, where he cooks delicious shish kabobs.  His son helps him in this business.  This cafe is located in the town center, Hakim has many customers because he cooks delicious and excellent shish kabobs, and the business yields a good profit.  Hakim needs to marry off his second son, but does not yet have a separate house for him and has little money for construction.  This is why he wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10,000 somoni and promises to repay it on-time.  Hakim relies on your support.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is 29 years old, married with two sons. Her older son is in 4th standard (grade), the other doesn’t go to school.  
She herself is involved in the business of selling animals. She buys young animals, raises them and sells them for a good profit to customers. 
She has been operating her business for the past 8 years. Her business earns a good profit every month which she utilizes to pay utilities. 
Her husband is a member of the agricultural profession. He is a farmer, growing different seasonal crops and selling them to customers. 
Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her animal sales business. With the loan, she will buy young animals (calves) to raise for sale for a good profit. She is hopeful that her business will give her better profits after investing the loan funds.

loans.use: To buy young animals (calves) for sale

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en: Taghreed is a 35-year-old mother of four children. Her husband works in a governmental institution earning a very humble salary. To be able to support her husband with the financial income of the family, Taghreed started selling blankets and clothes five years ago. By doing this, they have been able to manage their daily living so far. Now Taghreed wants to buy more blankets and clothes in a larger quantity to get a wholesale price, so she can re-sell them and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and clothes in a larger quantity to get a wholesale price

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira, leader du groupe d’affaire «Utulivu », est  senior entrepreneur, âgée de 56  ans, veuve, mère de 6 jeunes enfants et de nombreux  petits fils et filles. Son mari fut décédé  suite d’une longue maladie chronique. Elle est  vendeuse de farine de maniocs dans un dépôt agricole au centre commercial de Birere. Il y a 15 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir   son 17eme crédit auprès de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  40 sacs de maniocs à marchander. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes  veuves exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Kavira is a senior entrepreneur and leader of the Utulivu business group. She is 56 years old and the widowed mother of six young children and of numerous grandchildren. Her husband died following a long chronic illness. She sells cassava flour at a farmer's depot in the Birere commercial center. She has been generating revenue through these small activities for the past 15 years.

She has now been granted her 17th loan from the Hekima MFI. This new loan will be used to buy 40 bags of cassava flour for retail sales. Furthermore she wishes to see her children grow up in comfort and would like to expand her business. This Hekima client thanks the organization for its actions in support of impoverished widows excluded from conventional banking.

loans.use: buy 40 bags of cassava flour

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Assylyn

texts.en:
Assylyn is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Assylyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
 
Assylyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Assylyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married with three children. Rebecca is 59 years old and lives in Tangub City.

Rebecca has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 50,000 PHP to  purchase stock for her general store.

Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the business and increase the products she sells in her retail store.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Rosalina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
 
Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is married with one child. Angela is 32 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.
Angela is in agricultural business, planting vegetables in her backyard like pumpkin, string beans, okra and others. She sells vegetables to earn a living and had this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php 15,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

Angela joined GDMPC in 2007, she is now four years member of the cooperative. Angela future plan in life is to have a good shelter. She plan to save portion of her income for the renovation of her house.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Rubielyn

texts.en:
Rubielyn is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Rubielyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Rubielyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 39 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running it for five years and also earns an income from a carenderia (local eatery). She has requested a PHP 49,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Rosita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF prior this loan. 

Rosita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 40 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosalina has a rope making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business. She has been in this business for eight years.  

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope making business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more local brooms to sell and to start selling small bites.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 
Marcial has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & vegetables like eggplant & string beans. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables for sale.
Marcial has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marcial hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables for sale

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf has almost seven years of experience working as a car mechanic. He is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man living with one parent and a sibling. He is specialized in car electric repairs. His shop is situated in his town, where he is known for his good business reputation and great customer service. Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new electric tools and supplies [to replace] the used ones. He states that with the new equipment he will be able to better serve his customers.

loans.use: to purchase new electric tools and supplies

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is married and has a pig roasting (lechon) business in the Philippines.

Zenaida has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more pigs for her business. She has been in this business for two years now, and earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for her pig roasting business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Teresita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 
Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Tugsjargal

texts.en: Tugsjargal is 46 years old and lives with her son, daughter-in-law and grandson in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in her sister's yard in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. Her son is doing one year of military duty and her daughter-in-law takes care of her newborn child. Tugsjargal started her grocery shop business in 2008. She sells groceries and frozen meat. She is very well known for her polite service. She wishes to expand her business. She is a workful and diligent woman who says, "I love what I do, but it has been a little tough due to my son's military duty and I hope I can support his family while he is gone." She is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrik loan to purchase more products such as meat and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as meat and vegetables

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Amelita works hard to support her family.

She has a grinding machine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Amelita is borrowing PHP 49,500 through NWTF to purchase more coconuts for her business.

Amelita has sustained her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to achieve her dream of saving money to expand her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a 44-year-old married woman with five children. She has a sari-sari store business in Talibon, Bohol. Emma sells items like soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods and eggs to the people in her community. She has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles. Emma hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Nancy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Evelyn has a shop that sells noodles, snacks and electronic loads from several networks like Globe and Smart. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy snacks, noodles and electronic loads to sell. 

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, noodles and electronic loads to sell

loans.name: Mwagaga

texts.en:
Mwagaga is a married man with three school-going children. His wife is a teacher who contributes to the family's basic needs. He lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Mwagaga has operated a business planting and selling tree seedlings for the past 10 years. In addition, he operates a motorcycle transportation business. His potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality where there are sometimes no customers for his business. He dreams of having the best tree seedlings plantation in his village.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase tree seedlings to plant and then sell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his living standard.

loans.use: To purchase tree seedlings to plant and then sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en: Bashiran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son and herself. Her son runs a grocery store while she sells bangles. Their business place is the same and they help each other handle the customers in one’s absence. They started their business two years ago. In this short time, they have obtained much respect among their customers due to their good services. With the loan, they will buy groceries and bangles to increase their sales and earns better profits. Her husband is a daily wage labor. She is hopeful that the investment will be profitable for their businesses.

loans.use: To buy groceries & bangles to sell

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en: Heidi is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Heidi provides motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service. Heidi has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Heidi hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store business, which helps provide for her family's daily needs. She sells items like soy sauce, vinegar and canned goods. She also cooks food that she sells to the people in her community. Perlita has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and fruits. She hopes to have a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and fruits

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is from the town of Jimenez Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old, married with 2 children. James owns & operates a business project, operating a habal-habal or a single motorcycle transport to make a living. This kind of transportation is common in rural areas, for travel from towns to barangays (villages). Each month, he earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of activity, He requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. He operates three motorcycle as of now.

In 2010, James joined GDMPC and he is now on the fifth cycle of loan. James is a good member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative. In the future, he hopes to have another motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts  for better service

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. 

Sheryl has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
 
Sheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Sheryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Pao

texts.en: Mrs. Pao is 40 years old and married with three children. Mrs. Pao and her husband are in the business of farming. Besides agriculture, they operate another business. She buys and resells recycled items, especially structures or broken parts of wooden houses that can be used again by poor families to rebuild their houses. These items include zinc, house columns, wooden boards and other housing structures. From this business, they typically earn around $10 USD per day to support their living and family’s needs. Currently, Mrs. Pao has lacked capital for her business. Therefore, Mrs. Pao would like to ask for a loan from Kiva’s lenders in the sum of $1,000 to buy her products. In the future, she plans to buy a plowing machine for growing crops and she hopes that she can expand her existing business more successfully.

loans.use: to buy items such as zinc, house columns, wooden boards and other housing structures to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes & personal accessories

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is a 31-year-old married man living with his wife and only child. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a home electrician for the past seven years. He works upon the requests of his clients and has one employee helping him with the work. He is the main income provider of his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing new tools for his business. He plans to take more projects and has to be equipped with the needed supplies so as to be meet the needs of his clients. Elie feels positive about his future work.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing new tools for his business.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Yorn, 57 years old, is a farmer and pig feeder earning $2 per day. Her husband sells traditional medicine and earns $3 per day. They have four children; two are studying and the other two are working and earn $5 per day together. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on house rental fees, $10 on school fees, $20 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy pigs and food to feed them for reselling. She wants to feed more pigs so she gets better profit and has more money.

loans.use: To buy pigs and food to feed them for reselling.

loans.name: May Ann

texts.en:
May Ann is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

May Ann has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
 
May Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, May Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Nory has a shop that sells detergents, dish washing liquids and soaps. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy detergents, dish washing liquids and soaps for selling.
 
Nory has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nory hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, dish washing liquids and soaps for selling.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 40 years of age, married and has four children. Her family lives within the village of Nagbukel San Isidro. All four of her children go to school, so her expenses have increased. Teresa would like her children to finish college so that they could have a better future someday. 

Teresa runs a direct selling business. She has had this business for five years and she's glad because her husband is supportive in improving the business they have. The couple works hard to make their dreams come true. In addition, Teresa is asking for financial assistance in the amount of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase dried fish, red eggs, beans and some cosmetic products needed in her retailing business. She hopes that through her requested loan, she will be able to improve the economic conditions of her family and support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, red eggs, beans and some cosmetic products needed in her retailing business.

loans.name: Shulamita

texts.en:
Shulamita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Shulamita has a bake shop that sells breads, cakes & pastries. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries. 
Shulamita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Shulamita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Delia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages . 
Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling. He started his career at a very young age working as a plumber. He is specialized in installing toilets, faucets, etc. This will be his second Kiva loan and he notes that his business productivity and income have increased since taking his first loan. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his business tools. He is sure that the loan amount will help him fulfill his business objectives. In the future, he plans to open his own shop.

loans.use: to renew his plumbing business tools.

loans.name: Maurice Otieno

texts.en:
Maurice is a Kenyan man aged 41. He is married with four children. He runs a soft drinks sales business. The business is situated in a bus terminus that is very busy, and his customers are travelers. He has been in the business for 10 years. He says that the business is good and the major challenges he has are financial constraints and the escalating prices of commodities. 

He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to increase stock of soft drinks to meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to give his children a good education to the university level. He also hopes to grow his cafe by putting up a permanent premises to run it in the future. He describes himself as God fearing, aggressive, responsible and humble.

loans.use: To buy stock of soft drinks.

loans.name: Villa Marre

texts.en:
Villa Marre is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 

Villa Marre has a shop that sells home made and flavored ice cream bars. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy raw ingredients for making home made ice cream. 

Villa Marre has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Villa Marre hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making home made ice cream to sell

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is a married man with four school going children. He has a house with electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Jumaa has operated a barber shop for the past ten years; in addition he also practices small scale farming. His potential clients are local community members and he faces a major challenge of low income due to low service charges. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase a new hair shaving machine for his business. He decided to join Yehu because Yehu understands its’ clients needs.

loans.use: To purchase a new hair shaving machine for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for his car repair shop

loans.name: Realyn

texts.en:
Realyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Realyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
 
Realyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Realyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Lama

texts.en:
Lama is a 29-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and two school-aged children. She works in producing handicrafts, embroidery/needlepoint and all artisanal work, and she's a very talented woman. She works upon request from clients who ask for special orders. She has been involved in this type of business since 2006. She works hard to support her husband. 

Today, Lama is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy textiles and tailoring supplies needed in order to increase her business productivity. In the future, she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy textiles and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a married woman with 4 children. She is engaged in fishing. She and her husband own a fishing boat that they use to catch fish. Regina sells her husband's catch at the market. Regina plans to use her loan to buy fishing hooks and nets and to repair their fishing boat. Regina hopes to earn more and be able to sustain their children's education.

loans.use: to buy fishing hooks and nets and to repair their fishing boat.

loans.name: Pera Group

texts.en:
Star, who is in her late 30s, is a widow with three children, two of whom go to school.  She has been a food vendor since 2005. She works from 2 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying out of stock items for her food business. Her dream is to one day be able to own a grocery.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Pera", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy out of stock items for her food business.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with ten school-going children. He has two wives that operate a small business and also contribute to the provision of the family's basic needs. He has a house with piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Bakari has operated as a large scale farmer for the past thirty years. His potential clients are his neighbors, friends and café owners. He faces a major challenge of irrigation, especially during the dry seasons when water is hard to find. He dreams of establishing a well operating farm ranch.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase crop seedlings to plant and hire laborers to help him on his farm. He decided to join Yehu because it offers loan facilities to men.

loans.use: To purchase crop seedlings to plant and hire laborers to help him on his farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 51 years old and married with 8 children, aged 33 to 18, living in her own house in Hoima, Uganda. She has been into the clothing business for 19 years. This enabled her to pay school fees for her children, and now four of them are through with school. She faces the challenge of the seasonal nature of her business, and her dream is to own a big boutique. Mary needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 23-year-old married man living with his wife and one child. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a plumber for more than five years. He works on a freelance basis, sticking with private projects and businesses. In parallel, he works in selling used metal in order to earn greater income and to better support his family, as he is the main income source. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase plumbing tools and supplies. This may include pipes, bathroom fixtures, etc. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 25%.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing tools and supplies such as pipes, bathroom fixtures, etc.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Noemi is making and peddling homemade ice cream bars. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy raw ingredients for making homemade ice cream. 

Noemi has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Noemi hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making homemade ice cream.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 31 years old and married with three children: a son and two daughters. Her son is in 5th standard while her daughters stay at home and manage the household work.
 
Nasreen herself is involved in a sewing business. She operates her business at her home to financially contribute to the family. Her business earns her a good amount which helps her to manage the household expenses. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother’s business. Her brother runs a canteen in a school where he sells different edible items like biscuits, chips, cold drinks and juices to the school children and earns income. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. With the loan, he will buy the edible items and cold drinks in larger quantities to put into his canteen for increasing his sales. 

Nasreen is hopeful that the investment will be proven beneficial for her brother’s business.

loans.use: To buy edible items and cold drinks for a canteen business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products for her cosmetic sales.

loans.name: Ghanem

texts.en:
Ghanem is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man, living with his wife and two children, who are still attending school. He is an experienced construction worker. He is especially talented at completing woodwork projects. He has been working for the past 15 years in this occupation. He works independently in his business. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more wood for his work. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by opening his own office and working with some construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for his work.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Ronalyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages on her mini store and at the same time she cooked food like viand and rice for extra income. She has had this business for three years.She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages and to buy ingredients for the menu she will be cooking on  the next days.. 

Ronalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ronalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru: Махмадали  трудолюбивый и честный человек. Ему 34года у него жена и  2 детей. Махмадали занимается куплей и продажей запчастей на местном рынке. Он работает усердно, и привозить высококачественные запчасти. Он имеет много постоянных клиентов и на рынке очень большой спрос для запчастей. Более 7 лет Махмадали успешно продолжает данный бизнес и у него очень хороший опыт. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки высококачественных запчастей с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Mahmadali is a hardworking and honest man. He is 34 years old, he has a wife and two children. Mahmadali is in buying and selling spare parts on the local market. He works diligently and brings in high quality spare parts. He has many regular customers and there's a large demand for this type of products on the market. Mahmadali has been successfully doing this business for more than seven years and he has a very good experience. He wants to get a loan in the amount of $3,000 USD to buy high quality spare parts with the purpose of growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Tampouy Paligwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme Fatimata est la représentante du groupe TAMPOUY PALIGWENDE. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 5mois. Quatre(04) de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend du poisson frais et des pagnes depuis 16ans.Elle a juste presenté les pagnes sur la photo mais elle veut acheter du poisson frais avec l'argent. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 08 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 03 cartons de poisson frais.

Mme économise pour agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne s’acheter un réfrigérateur pour conserver le poisson et aider son mari à payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatimata is the representative for the Tampouy Paligwende group. She is married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 17 years old and the youngest only 5 months. Four of her children go to school. She has five people under her care.

She has sold fresh fish and pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) for the past 16 years. She is displaying the pagnes in the picture but she wants to buy fresh fish with the loan. She gets her supplies from the sector 8 market in town. Her customers are both women and men. She wants to buy three boxes of fresh fish.

Mrs. Fatimata is saving to expand her business. She aims to buy a refrigerator to store fish and help her husband pay tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: buy three cartons of fresh fish

loans.name: Azizaga

texts.en: Azizaga is 47 years old. He has been working in retail for the last six years. He manages his business together with his wife. Azizaga has two daughters and two sons. His goal is to distribute his products and to expand his coverage. For this reason, Azizaga applied for a his second loan through Aqroinvest. He will use it to buy merchandise to sell: water, soft drinks, cookies, candy, juice and more. Azizaga hopes to use the profit from the business to help his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Darryl

texts.en:
Darryl is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.
 
Darryl is providing motorcycle or "motorela" transport services . He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Darryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Darryl hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Chimako

texts.en:
Chimako is a married man with four school-going children. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. He has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Chimako has operated a cafe for the past four years; his potential customers are local area residents. He faces a major challenge of lack of customers especially during the weekend. He dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for his business. He decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for his business.

loans.name: Martin Okoth

texts.en:
Martin is a 31-year-old married man. His wife is a business lady and they have three children with ages ranging from four to ten years old. He owns a small business where he sells soft drinks, cakes and other snacks to passersby near the country bus station in Nairobi. He has been in this business for nine years now. 

He says that this business is profitable and the major challenges he has are those of financial constraints and weather changes. He hopes to grow his business to wholesale. He also plans to give his children a good education to the university level. He describes himself as responsible and committed to his work.

loans.use: to buy stock of cakes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mohamad Khayr

texts.en: Mohamad is a 31-year-old Lebanese single man living with his mother. He started to work as a freelance home electrician and has been doing so for the past 10 years. With his requested loan of $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to purchase new electricA. gear and tackle. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming year. In the future, he plans to expand his business operation into wider areas and villages.

loans.use: to purchase new electrical gear and tackle.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a hog raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. She started her business with five pigs for fattening. When she got expert with the business, she continued it with one sow until it produced many piglets when it gave birth. There was also a time that she was hopeless when her sow gave birth and only two were alive. Nena did not lose her hopes. Instead, she continues to operate her business. 

With her business, she was able to send her children to school. Two of her children have already finished their education, and only the youngest is still studying. Now, Nena needs additional working capital for the maintenance of her 25 piglets and eight hogs for fattening. She is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for her pigs.

Nena is looking forward to continued development of her business. She wants to finish her youngest child's education through profits she earns from the business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her direct selling business.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is a 40-year-old man who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is the father of nine children. His elder son is still in primary school and the youngest is three years old. Abdu studied only in primary school and dropped out looking for income sources to help him stay alive.

Abdu started his business long ago on a movable wheelbarrow usually containing a tomato basket and one other basket of potatoes. In order to feed his family, which kept waiting for his arrival, he would move from one neighborhood to another in Sana'a so that he could generate some money after paying back the original price of the baskets. Abdu kept on this way for a long time and then developed his business to be based in a fixed place under an umbrella, where he now sells his vegetables instead of moving on a wheelbarrow. 

Abdu took a loan of 150,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank in order to purchase enough vegetables to meet the demand of his clientele, which has expanded. This loan will allow him to purchase all types of vegetables and to build a good relationship with his clientele by serving their needs.

In the future, Abdu hopes to expand his business and improve his capital, as this will help in generating more income. Abdu is also saving to buy a small truck, which he will use to bring his vegetables from the vegetable market.

loans.use: to purchase enough vegetables to meet his clientele's demand

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children, two of whom are still attending school. In 1991, he invested in a small piece of land and transformed it into a parking lot. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform needed maintenance on the parking lot and to install water canals to avoid facing water flooding during the winter season. This will be his third Kiva loan.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on the parking lot and install water canals.

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years.

She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Gema has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Josejhane

texts.en:
Josejhane is 30 years old and is a married woman with 1 child. Her husband is a driver and owns his own tricycle.

Josejhane is into a buy & sell business. She buys chickens and pigs to sell at the market. She has been in this business for 2 years. She requested this loan to buy more chickens and pigs to sell. She hopes to save for her child's future.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and pigs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase meat, liver and other ingredients for his street food business.

loans.name: Gracelle

texts.en:
Gracelle is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. She provides motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy tools and to pay for gasoline for the service. 

Gracelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the service

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has owned a pastry shop since 2006, and has more than 15 years of experience. He cooperates financially with his wife, who works as a teacher to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more merchandise. He intends to augment his business productivity to get higher revenue in order to improve the family’s financial status.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 45 years old, married and has four children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from tending a canteen in the market. Edna has been engaged in her business for more than one year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell. Edna plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita Alindayu's main source of income comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. She is from Centro 1, Angadanan, Isabela. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 800 Philippine pesos (PHP) a day.

She joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Conchita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon, living with his parents and one sibling. He started to work in installing curtains at a very young age. He works upon requests of the clients.  With his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to renew his business tools. In the future, he plans to open his own curtain factory. This is his first Kiva loan and he hopes that it will help him achieve substantial growth with the coming year.

loans.use: to renew his business tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock of bread, cakes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Yormuhammad

texts.ru: Ёрмухаммад умный и честный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Ёрмухаммад занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном он сеет пшеницу, а потом продает на рынке. Кроме этого он занимается купля продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он начал данный бизнес с одного скота, а в настоящее время у него двух голов  коровы с теленком.  Ёрмухаммад хотел бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки селитры и аммофос для того чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Yormuhammad is a smart and honest man. He is married and is a loving father of three children. Yormuhammad grows agriculture crops. He mainly sows wheat and then later sells it on the market. Also he does buying and selling of large horned cattle. He started this business from one animal and now has two heads of cows and one calf. Yormuhammad wants to receive a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to purchase nitrate and ammophos to collect a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase of nitrate and ammophos.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
