Cerila is 43 years old and is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 18 years old. Cerila's husband works as a carpenter and a farmer.

Cerila runs a sari-sari (variety) store business in Talibon, Bohol. She sells items like canned goods, coffee and also detergent. Cerila also raises hogs in her backyard. 

Cerila plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell at her store. She will also pay for installation of electricity since they do not have it yet in their house. Cerila hopes to sustain her children's education and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell and pay for electricity installation.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is an army officer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mwanajuma has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years; her potential customers are local community members. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from point of purchase to her place of sale. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loans.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: C5679 Intwarane Group

texts.en:
Esperance is 34 years old and she is married with two children who are 6 and 8 years old. She owns a business selling pineapples, passion fruit, apples and so on. Esperance is the leader of this group, which is called "Intwarane" in the local language. She is the first person on the right side. Esperance has been in this business for about one year and her business is open from 6 am until 6 pm every day. She employs one person to help her. 

Esperance and her team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to increase their quantities of pineapples, passion fruit, and green bananas to sell. Esperance and her team will reinvest their profits into their businesses and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit like pineapples, passion fruit, green bananas, etc.

loans.name: Fazeelat's Group

texts.en:
Fazeelat, 52 years old, is involved in the garment business. She specifically deals with jeans. She sells her products to different clothing sellers at the market and to her community clients at a profit. She started this business two years ago.  

Her husband is a driver, and she is a mother of four daughters. Her eldest daughter is a Master's degree holder and now is in the teaching profession. Her remaining daughters are also getting an education. 

Fazeelat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business. With the loan, she will buy jeans in larger quantity to fill her clients' orders and increase her income. She is hopeful that the loan investment will take her business to more profitable position.

loans.use: To buy jeans to sell.

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en: Bassem is a 26-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with one parent and four siblings. Four years ago, he got involved in the construction field working as a painter. In 2009, he decided to work independently sticking with multiple projects. Today, he is asking to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy materials needed to improve his business operation. In the future, he hopes to be able to open his own shop where he will sell paints and all related tools.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to improve his business operation.

loans.name: C5670Umucyo Group

texts.en:
Ancille is 51 years old and is a widow. She has six children between the ages of 4 and 16 years. Ancille is the president of a group called “Umucyo.” She is the first person on the left side of the photo. Ancille sells bananas, and has been working for two years.

Ancille and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more bananas. With the profits from this loan, Ancille and her team would like to satisfy the basic needs of their families, and start saving for their children.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman with three school going children. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is house rent. 

Fatuma has operated a cosmetics shop for the past ten years; her potential clients are the women of her community. She faces the major challenge of rent for her business premises. She dreams of having a wide variety of products at her cosmetics shop.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Nassim

texts.en: Nassim is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling. He has five years of experience working with mobile phones. He opened his own store in 2006. With his loan requested of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to increase his purchases of new mobile phones and prepaid telephone cards. The majority of mobile phone users in Lebanon purchase these prepaid cards. He reports that his income will be increased by 15% as a result of the loan. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase its capital.

loans.use: increase his purchases of new mobile phones and prepaid telephone cards.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is married and happily living with her husband and two children. Analyn is engaged in a retailing business, which is a sari-sari store. She sells snack foods, breads, beverages, candies, and spices. Analyn has been in this business for 13 years. Aside from the sari-sari store business, she also operates a van for hire for passenger transportation.
Analyn’s sari-sari store business is a big help for her and to her family because the profit from her business is used for the daily allowances of her children. She has low income for now because some of her customers did not pay for her products in cash. Her customers have not paid for their credit. 
With her desire to gain higher income, Analyn is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy additional commodities like canned goods, medicines, diapers, and beauty products.

loans.use: to buy additional commodities like canned goods, medicines, diapers, and beauty products.

loans.name: Yurdusev

texts.en:
Yurdusev is married with two children.  The elder is studying at university and the other is still in high school.  She has been a real estate agent for two years.  Since starting her business she has become more active in social and business life.  She is happy to have increased her self-confidence, become successful at work, and with this work found a way to contribute to her family.  It is important to her to be known as a woman who is able to stand on her own two feet.

She will use this loan to improve the physical appearance of her office  and buy a computer to improve efficiency.   Being able to afford necessary items for her office is a relief for her.  Also she is very happy to be a part of this organization that helps improve the direction of women’s lives. Her plan is to complete the things her office is missing.  Since most people think the work environment is very important, and that one’s office is actually a reflection of one’s business, her plan to equip her office properly  is important in order for her to develop her customer base.   

With Maya support, she wants to add a remodeling  referral   service to her real  estate business for clients who need to make changes to the properties they have rented or purchased. Being able to receive this loan allows her to meet her own needs without burdening her family.  This makes her happy and in turn her family as well. Yurdusev is industrious and principled.  It is these qualities that guide her business decisions.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff.


Yurdusev evli ve 2 çocuğu var.  Büyük olan üniversitede okuyor diğeri liseye devam ediyor.  İki yıldır Emlakçılık yapıyor.  Çalışmaya başlaması ile sosyal ve iş hayatında daha aktif biri oldu.  Kendine özgüveni nin arttığı için ,işte başarılı olduğu ve ailesine katkıda bulunduğu için çok mutlu.  Bir kadın olarak kendi ayaklarının üstünde durabileceğini bilmek ona yetiyor.
Bu kredi le Yurdusev Hanım,dükkanın görünümünü değiştirecek ve bilgisayar alacak.  Ofisinin yeni ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak onu rahatlatacak.  Ayrıca kadınlara yönelik böyle güzel bir projenin içinde olmak onu mutlu ediyor. 
Yurdusev Hanım’ın planı ofisin eksiklerini tamamlamak.  İnsanlar için çalışma ortamları çok önemli,aslında çalıştığınız ofis sizin işinizi yansıtır,planı ,ofisin eksiklerini tamamalayarak,müşteri potansiyelini arttırmak.
Maya’dan alacağı destek ile,inşaat sektörüne de başlamak istiyor. 
Bu kredi  ile ailesine yük olmadan, kendi ihtiyaçlarını karşılayabiliyor.  Bu onu mutlu ediyor ve ailesini de mutlu ediyor.Yurtsev Hanım çalışkan ve prensip sahibi.  Bu özellikler onun işi ile ilgili karaların arkasında durmasını sağlıyor.

loans.use: to improve the physical appearance of her office and buy a computer.

loans.name: Taher

texts.en:
Taher is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He has 12 years of experience working as a farmer. In 2000, he bought a plot of land where he started to cultivate different types of vegetables and fruits according to the season. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds because he's planning to expand his business. He estimates that with the coming harvesting, his profits will increase.

loans.use: to buy new farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Diamo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Diamo est créé depuis le 4 décembre 2007 il est composé de treize femmes qui sont animées d'un esprit d'entraide et mènent comme principale activité le commerce.

La responsable Adama est âgée de 38 ans elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants, elle a ses deux neveux en charge; elle s'active dans le commerce de poisson séché et capitalise une expérience de plus de dix ans. Elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou blanc avec des fleurettes roses et a levé la main droite.

Elle s’approvisionne au niveau du port de la capitale et revend au marché central de la ville.

Son prêt lui permettra d'augmenter la quantité de poisson séché pour satisfaire la clientèle et se faire plus de revenus.

Elle soutient son mari dans les dépenses de la famille et ses enfants pour leurs divers besoins. Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices acheter un terrain pour ses enfants voire même leur construire une maison.
texts.en:
The Diamo solidarity group was established on December 4, 2007 and is made up of thirteen women who are inspired by a spirit of mutual assistance and run businesses primarily focused on trade.

Adama, the leader, is 38 years old. She is married and the mother of four children; her two nephews are in her care. She is very buS. in the trade of dried fish and makes the most of her more than ten years' experience. In the photo, Adama is standing at right, dressed in a white boubou [traditional African dress] with pink flowers and her right hand raised.

Adama gets her supplies at the port of the capital and resells them in the main marketplace in town.

Her loan will allow her to increase the quantity of dried fish in order to please her customers and increase her income.

Adama supports her husband in the expenses of the family and her children for their various needs. With her profits, she hopes to purchase a plot of land for her children, and perhaps even to build them a house.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish intended for sale.

loans.name: Khar Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Khar Yalla est créé le 9 juin 2008 au cycle 2 du Banc Villageois, il est composé de seize femmes issues du même quartier et qui s'activent dans le petit commerce.

La responsable madame Aïcha âgée de 66 ans est mariée mère de sept enfants, elle a en charge ses deux petits fils. Elle mène une activité de commerce d'ustensiles  avec une bonne expérience. Elle est assisse sur la photo à droite habillée en orange- noir avec un éventail à la main droite.

Elle achéte ses produits dans les grandes villes et vend dans la commune.

Son prêt lui servira à augmenter ses ustensiles pour se faire plus de revenus.


Elle compte avec ses bénéfices se constituer une bonne épargne pour obtenir encore un prêt plus élevé mais aussi améliorer le bien être familial.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Khar Yalla was created on June 9, 2008 upon cycle 2 of the Banc Villageois. The group is comprised of sixteen women from the same district. They are active in small-scale commerce. 

The group's official, Ms. Aïcha, is 66 years old and a married mother of seven children. She supports her two grandchildren. She runs a business selling utensils and has good experience in it. In the photo, she is the one seated at the right, dressed in orange and black, and holding a fan in her right hand. 

Ms. Aïcha buys her goods in the big cities and sells them in her Commune. 

Her loan will serve to increase her supply of utensils in order to make more income. With the profits, she plans on building up significant savings in order to obtain another loan that is larger but also to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy utensils for resale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife and three children. He is an experienced construction worker, working for almost 23 years. He is especially talented at completing woodwork. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more wood for his business. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and invest in a new wood-sanding machine. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for his business.

loans.name: C5624 Abunzubumwe Group

texts.en:
Vestine is 54 years old and is a widow with six children between the ages of 17 and 24. She is a businesswoman selling charcoal. Vestine is also the leader of this group, which is called "Abunzubumwe" in the local language. Vestine employs two persons to help her and she has eleven years of experience. She starts her work at 7:00 a.m and works until 6:00 p.m every day. She is the first person on the left in the picture.

Vestine and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by buying more sacks of charcoal to sell. Once their businesses have expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and save money for their children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 31-year-old married man living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a shop since 2002 where he sells air conditioners. He also performs needed maintenance on broken ones. He is the only income provider of his family. 

Today, Ahmad is asking to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional air conditioners in order to sell them and make good profits. In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional air conditioners.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon is 34 years old, divorced, and has two children. She has been cultivating a rice crop for many years. She is hard working so that she can feed her children. 

To increase her profits, Phon has decided to enter the sales business from which she can generate approximately $4 each day. She sells fresh seafood to local people in a market at Kompot province.

Phon is requesting a loan from HKL, which she will to use as a capital to buy her additional products to sell. With the increase in income, she will buy a motorcycle in order to support her sales business.  She will also save some money for her children’s education and future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Bintiomari

texts.en:
Bintiomari is a single woman with three school-going children. She has a house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a food stall for the past four years; in addition she owns a rental house. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of theft. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase vegetables for her stall and also renovate her rental house. She decided to join Yehu because it offers a flexible repayment period to its clients.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for her stall and also renovate her rental house.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is 44 years old married. She has seven children: four sons and three daughters. Her eldest son was educated till 9th standard and now is working in an optical shop. Her remaining children are enrolled in a school and getting their education. 

Her husband sells mobile phones and wrist watches. He operates a shop in the market where he sells his products to his customers. He has been in this business for the past five years.
 
Zubaida herself knows the skills of sewing, which she uses to supplement the income for the family. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy mobile phones and wrist watches to sell. She is hopeful that his business will be improved further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and wrist watches for selling.

loans.name: Inoyatullo

texts.ru: Иноятулло женат, и у них трое детей. Он занимается купля продажей скота. Иноятулло занимается этим бизнесом более 6 лет и успешно продолжает данный бизнес. Он начинал этот бизнес с двух голов коровы, постепенно расширил данный бизнес и в настоящее время у него 11 голов крупного рогатого скота. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки скота. Он заранее благодарить всех вас за поддержку и помощь. Спасибо вам большое.
texts.en: Inoyatullo is married and has three children. He buys and sells cattle. Inoyatullo has been in this business for six years and is successful in it. He started the business with two cows and gradually expanded the business. At this time he has eleven heads of large horned cattle. He wants to receive a loan in the amount of $3000 USD to buy cattle. He is thanking everyone in advance for your support and help. Thank you very much.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two siblings.

He has 10 years of experience working as a farmer. He cultivates all types of vegetables and has one part-time employee helping him with the work. His products are sold to multiple agricultural markets. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to install a water canal to help his crops grow well. In the future, he plans to further expand his business and start cultivating exotic fruits.

loans.use: to install a water canal to help crops grow well.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is 58 years old and married. She has four children. 

Artemia has been in the scrap buying business for 10 years. She earns about 5,000 PHP per month with her business. Artemia also buys coconut shells to make charcoal. 

Artemia has requested a loan to buy more scrap to sell. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 26-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife. 

He started his own business working as a floor covering laborer almost three years ago. He has nine years of experience working in the same occupation. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to help their families with their business income. 

Despite his situation, he feels positive about his business potential for the coming year. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a paving cutter machine and renew his business tools. In the future, he hopes to start working directly with multiple construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy a paving cutter machine and renew his business tools.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with three school-going children. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

She has operated a food stall for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area community members. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from the market to her place of business. She dreams of opening a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase eight bags of wheat flour and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of the loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase eight bags of wheat flour and beans for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 41-year-old married man living with his wife and three siblings. In 1998, he started to work as a taxi driver, transporting customers to their desired location. After realizing that his revenue was barely sufficient to satisfy the family's needs, he decided to also open a vegetable shop in order to earn higher income. It’s very common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs so as to be able to handle the high costs of living. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his taxi to make it more secure. 

In the future, he plans to purchase a new car so that he can continue his business expansion.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en:
Anitha is 26 years old and married with two children between 3 and 5 years old. Anitha owns a business selling mobile phones. This is her third successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Anitha has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her mobile phone business. This will allow her to purchase new mobile phones. With the profits, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family and she will be able to reinvest in her mobile phone business.

loans.use: To purchase new mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Tuichibai

texts.ru: Туйчибай целеустремленный и честный человек. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка и помогает мужу. Он занимается услугой таксиста. Также он занимается откормом скота и у него очень хороший опыт по данному бизнесу. Более 20 лет он занимается в данном бизнесе и ему помогает его жена и сыновья. Данный бизнес является семейным бизнесом. Туйчибай хочет улучшить свое жилищное условия и хотел бы получить займ в размере 12500 Сомони. Он планирует строит дом сыну, и покупать шифер для своего дома. Туйчибай заранее благодарить вас за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Tuichibai is a purposeful and honest man. He is married. His wife is a homemaker and helps her husband. He is a taxi diver and also feeds the cattle and has a very good experience in this type of business. For more than twenty years he has been in this business with help of his wife and sons. This is their family business. Tuichibai wants to improve his living conditions and wants to get a loan in the amount of 12500 somoni. He plans to build a house for his son and buy slates for the house. Tuichibai is thankful in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to purchase slates.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is too young for school. Her husband is a taxi driver who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwanajuma has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from point of purchase to her place of business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer care.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a 22-year-old man. He is employed and has a decent salary. His father has a commercial store in Jenin city in Palestine. 

Hamzeh wants to purchase new home furniture for the bedroom, living room, etc., but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Hamzeh gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase new home furniture and live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Aliyah

texts.en: Aliyah is a 52-year-old widowed woman living with her children in Lebanon. In 1997, she opened a mini-market in her town. With her requested loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., she will be able to increase her store’s inventory of food products and provisions. It is very common in Lebanon to find small supermarkets selling perishable and non-perishable goods. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands. In the future, and because of her older age, Aliyah plans to concede her business to her children.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory of food products and provisions.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her carpet weaving and clothes-selling business. She is an expert in her work. She weaves beautifully designed carpets, which sell for good amounts. She sells her carpet and clothes to different shops and earns a good income every month. 

Rukhsana has been in this profession for the past 15 years. With the loan, she will buy thread for weaving carpets and clothes in larger quantity for selling. She is hopeful that the investment will double her business profit.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving carpet and clothes for selling.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom is a 52-year-old married woman. She has a life partner in her husband who is in the same career as her. They cultivate rice crops for their livelihood. Together, they earn a profit of about $5 per day by doing this business. They have given birth to seven children who live together with them in a home. 

Currently, Mrs. Mom has encountered difficulties in her farming because her plowing machine has broken down in the last few months. She wants to fix this machine and use it again during the rainy season this year. However, she doesn’t have enough money to repair it yet. 

Mrs. Mom wants to use this loan to fix her plowing machine and buy some mineral fertilizers for her rice crop. This is her first loan with Kiva. She would like to say thank you to all of Kiva’s lenders who kindly help her family as well as other poor people.

loans.use: to fix her plowing machine and buy some mineral fertilizers for her rice crop.

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school while the others are working. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Sikukuu has operated a food stall for the past 10 years; additionally, she also sells firewood. Her potential clients are her neighbors and women of her community. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, Sikukuu wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility to loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos onde todos frequentam a escola.Fez a 5ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.  

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é agricultora ha mais de 20 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao de uma casa (areia, cimento, pedra, blocos, e outros), para obra da sua casa.Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 3.500.00mt, 8.000.00mt, e 9.000.00mt, todos para iniciar a sua obra.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para concluir a sua casa.
texts.en:
Luisa was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She went to school through fifth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

She's never left Boane. She's been farming for more than 20 years and earns about 3,000 meticals a month. She uses her salary for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account (BIM).
She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also clients of the institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, cinder blocks, etc.) to continue work on her house. Her first loans, in the amounts of 3,500, 8,000, and 9,000 meticals, were all used on the house.
She is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, cinder blocks, etc.) to continue work on her house.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 34-year-old Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and three children who are still attending school. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2008. He has more than nine years of experience working in the same field. His work is specialized in home manufacturing. Today, Ahmad is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his business tools. In the future, he plans to open his own manufacturing business.

loans.use: to renew his business tools.

loans.name: C2190 Inganji Group

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 29 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 6 years old. He is the leader of this group, which is called "Inganji." Jean Paul is in the middle of this group. Jean Paul has been in this business for about four years. The business hours are from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day.

Jean Paul and his team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, this team will expand their business by purchasing more products like bananas, beans, potatoes and so on. If successful, Jean Paul and his team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn would allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. Additionally, they would continue to improve their families' lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase more potatoes, bananas, beans, sweet potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Watta

texts.en: Watta is 29 years old and lives in Paynesville, Liberia. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have an 8-year-old child who is currently in school and lives at home. For the past eight years, she has been selling alcoholic drinks in her community. She likes the way customers respond to her business. Watta is requesting a loan to purchase more alcoholic drinks -- big apple, godfather, army bitter and white spirits -- for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks for her business.

loans.name: Manuchekhr

texts.ru: Манучехр возраст 21 год, не женат. Манучехр родился в 1990 году 12 октября в семье служащего. В 1997 году он поступил в школу, которую  успешно закончил в 2008 году.  В 2008 году Манучехр поступил в Таджикский  Государственный Университет Коммерции на факультет «финансы и кредит». В настоящее время он учится на третьем курсе. Манучехр очень активный и целеустремленный юноша, участвует во всех молодежных, студенческих мероприятиях, у него  много друзей, среди которых имеет хорошую репутацию. Манучехр  запрашивает займ на сумму 650$ США для  оплаты годового обучения. Он надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Manuchekhr is 21 years old and single.  He was born in October of 1990 into a military family.  He started school in 1997 and successfully graduated from it in 2008.  Manuchekhr was accepted to the finances and credit division of Tajik State Commerce University in 2008.  Currently, he is in his third year of the university.  Manuchekhr is a very active and goal-oriented young man, who participates in all youth, student events and has many friends, among whom he has a good reputation.  Manuchekhr is requesting a loan of $650 to pay for one year of education.  He hopes to receive your support.

loans.use: to pay for university studies

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a divorced woman with five children in school. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mlongo has operated a food stall for the past four years; her potential clients are the area locals. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its convenient terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy ready-made garments to increase his sales and earn better profits. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. In these years, he has achieved a good clientele base by providing timely services and a variety of garments. 

Zubaida herself is a skillful lady. She operates a sewing business at her home. Her husband is involved in the tye-dye business. Her remaining children are also involved in different works. Her eldest son is in a mobile-phone selling business. Her third son helps his father in his business. Her youngest son does sewing works. Her daughter has completed her education until 10th standard and now does sewing and embroidery works at home. All her children are contributing to the family financially from their earnings. Zubaida is hopeful that her son’s business will improve further after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy ready-made garments for selling.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 39-year-old man who lives in Old Sana'a, Yemen. He is the father of three young children. He received higher education long ago but could not continue his studies as he was busy helping his father in his trade of traditional jambia (a short dagger worn on a belt).

Mohammed learned the trade from his father, who inherited it from his ancestors. Like his ancestors, Mohammed is totally dependent on the income from this business to feed his family and to cover their living expenses. 

Mohammed took a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank in order to purchase some materials related to his business as well as some ready-made traditional belts. This loan will help Mohammed to meet the demand of his clientele in providing the types of traditional belts they require.

In the future, Mohammed plans to rebuild his old house and enroll his youngest son in a private school. Unlike his father, Mohammed doesn't like his sons to learn his trade because he wants them to complete their higher education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new traditional belts

loans.name: C2195 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Francois, a 41-year-old married father of five children between the ages of 10 and 17, is the president of a group called "Tuzamurane." This is his fourth successful year in the business of selling sorghum. He works every day from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m., and he employs three people to help him.

Francois and his team have requested a loan in order to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to sell. With this profit, Francois and his team will reinvest in their business, pay children's school fees and save money for their families.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of sorghum.

loans.name: Tosheka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bungilila, leader du groupe d’affaire «Tosheka », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 43  ans, mariée, mère de 9 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un pasteur évangéliste dans une église pentecôtiste. Elle est  vendeuse d’habits friperie dans un marché communal de Katindo. Il y a 5 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir   son 12eme crédit auprès de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir à compléter les fonds (montants en banque) d’achat parcelle (projet encours d’exécution par sa famille). En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes  exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Bungilila, one of our clients and leader of the "Tosheka" business group, is a 43-year-old entrepreneur and a married mother of nine young children.  Her husband is an evangelist pastor in a Pentecostal church.  She sells secondhand clothing in a Katindo communal market.  For five years now, she has been working these small, income-generating activities.  At the same time, she has just taken out her 12th loan with the MFI Hekima.  This new loan should help her to round out her financing (amounts in the bank) to purchase a parcel of land (her family’s project that is currently underway).  In addition, she would like to see her children grow up comfortably and also expand her business.  This client would like to thank Hekima for its work on behalf of poor women who don’t have access to conventional banks.

loans.use: to purchase a parcel of land

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase eight sheep and fodder.

loans.name: C2192  Twishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Theoneste is 28 years old and married. He is the president of a group that is called "Twishyizehamwe" in the local language. The group is composed of three people: one man and two women. Theoneste is the first person on the right side. He sells clothes, and his business is well organized. He works from 7 am until 8 pm every day and has four years of experience.

Theoneste and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more clothes to sell. With the resulting profit, Theoneste and his team will be able to save in their future and reinvest in their business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer and drives a tricycle for transportating passengers. Ruth runs a fruit and vegetable business. She sells spices, red eggs, cabbage, and beans. She successfully sent her three children to school and is happy to share that they are now all professionals through the profits she earned from the business.

Ruth wants to expand her business by adding products to sell in her village. Even though her children support her financially, she wants to stand on her own because someday her children will have their own family. Ruth is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy bitter gourd, cabbage, spices, eggs, and beans. She hopes for the growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy bitter gourd, cabbage, spices, eggs and beans.

loans.name: C2197  Abizeye Yesu Group

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 27 years old and married with two children who are 3 and 5 years old. He is the leader of this group, which is called “Abizeye yesu” in the local language. In the picture, he is in the middle in the white shirt.

Jean Baptiste sells charcoal and he has been working for three years. His business is open from 6 am until 5 pm every day.

Jean Baptiste and his group have requested a loan from the Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses and to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell. With any profits from the loan, Jean Baptiste and his team would like to satisfy the basic needs of their families, reinvest in their businesses, and start saving for their futures.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran is married with two children, a son and a daughter. Her son is a loader by profession and operates a loading and unloading business. He uses a tractor to deliver goods to designated places. He is known among his customers for his good service. Sugran's daughter is involved in a sewing business. She learned this skill from Sugran, and they both sew from home to supplement the family's income. Sugran's husband is also a driver. 

Sugran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will replace the tractor’s old tyres with new ones and repair its body. She is hopeful that the loan investment will give a new look to her son’s tractor and help him improve his business's financial condition.

loans.use: to replace tyres and repair the body of a tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep, hay and feed

loans.name: Mawaheb

texts.en: Mawaheb is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married and has one son and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary, in addition to his work in the cosmetics store. Mawaheb has a cosmetics store, and she wants to purchase more accessories, cosmetics, and perfumes to sell, but the amount of money she has isn't sufficient, so she needs to take out a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Mawaheb gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase more accessories, cosmetics, and perfumes to sell. She will have a bigger collection, and she will be able to compete with others, increase her sales, and in so doing raise her income and improve living conditions for her family. Mawaheb is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed in the store instead.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, cosmetics, and perfumes to sell

loans.name: C9360 Abisunganye Group

texts.en: Davorose, 44 years old, is married and has three children between 3 and 7 years old. She is the leader of this group, which is called Abisunganye in the local language. Davorose has four years' experience selling various goods like beans, cassava, and sweet potatoes. In the photo, she is in the middle of the group. Davorose and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses and purchase more goods like beans, cassava, and sweet potatoes to sell. With profits from the loan, Davorose and her team would like to satisfy their families' basic needs and start saving for their future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, cassava, sweet potatoes, and so on

loans.name: Ramla

texts.en: Ramla has finished paying her previous Kiva loan, and she and her family are doing fine. She is now requesting another loan, which she wants to use to expand her business. She wants 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a blow-dryer and cosmetics, and also to rent a new shop for her business

loans.name: Shamshad Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad bibi is 31 years old and married with five sons. Two of her sons go to school, but the others don't. Her husband is an electrician by profession, and  offers his customers electricity repairing services. He is very skillful in his business and has been operating it for the past 15 years.

Shamshad herself is involved in a sewing business. She does sewing & embroidery works at home by receiving orders from her neighboring clients. She uses her income to pay for utilities.

Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy electricity repairing tools, like a drill machine and pliers, to provide better services to his customers. She is hopeful that the loan investment will be profitable one for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy electricity repairing tools.

loans.name: C9362 Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
Azarias, 25 years old, is married. He is the leader of a group called "Duterimbere" in the local language. In the picture, Azarias is the first person on the left side and has two years of experience selling products like maize, sorghum, and beans. His business is well organized. He works from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day.

Azarias has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more maize, sorghum, and beans to sell. With any profit, Azarias and his team will be able to save for the future and pay medical insurance for their family.

loans.use: To purchase more products like maize, sorghum, and beans.

loans.name: Pay In Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Pay In” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. Isatu is 30 years old, married to a teacher, and has two children. Isatu sells slippers and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Isatu will invest in her business by buying dozens of slippers for resale.

loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamwinyi

texts.en:
Mwanamwinyi is a married woman with two grown children. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwanamwinyi has operated a business selling lesos (kangas - an African garment) for the past ten years; in addition she also sells piped water. Her potential clients are the local community members. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of lesos and new pipes for her piped-water selling business. She decided to join Yehu because she wanted access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of lesos and new pipes for her piped-water selling business.

loans.name: Mwanadie

texts.en:
Mwanadie is a married woman with three school-going children. Her husband is a taxi driver who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mwanadie has operated a tailoring business for the past ten years; her potential clients are her friends, neighbors, and her area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where demand is high during the end of the month only. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase cloth materials for business. She decided to join Yehu to get capital for expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
Bassem is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married, and lives with three family members- one of whom works.

He has owned his food market since 1993, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese, dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, as he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2,700 in order to renovate his market’s floor and walls and to add more food items. He is aiming to gain more profits which would give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his market’s floor and walls and to add more food items

loans.name: Force Plus Group

texts.en:
Kisita is the leader of the community bank named “Force Plus,” which is composed of 28 micro-entrepreneurs. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses through loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Kisita started her business in 1971, selling corn and cassava flour. Today, she operates a restaurant. She is 51 years old, married and has seven children between the ages of 27 and 32. From 2002 to 2004, her restaurant prospered thanks to good management and accumulated profits. Today, her business makes about $65 per week. Currently, Kisita is happy to be part of one of Hope’s groups. With this loan, she is planning to reinforce the inventory of her restaurant by buying flour, beans and charcoal in order to increase her profit. Her ambition is to someday open a charcoal facility in her area. She sells in the mid-eastern area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to reinforce the inventory of her restaurant by buying flour, beans and charcoal in order to increase the profits.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Saher

texts.en:
Saher is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married, and a father of one child.

Saher has owned his shop since 2004, selling mobiles phones and accessories. He has experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more items for sale. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more items for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, chocolates, oil, cooking oil, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Ouday

texts.en:
Ouday is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married, and a father of six children.

Ouday is a tailor; in 2000 he decided to open a workshop- making, repairing, and altering clothing, such as suits, coats and trousers for women. He has more than fifteen years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to buy more supplies. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to buy more supplies

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school while the other three are too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing the family's basic needs. She has a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mwanakombo has worked as a food vendor for the past four years; she also sells charcoal. Her potential clients are the area community members. She faces a major challenge of storage for her goods because she sells perishable products. She dreams of establishing a hotel.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stocks of rice, wheat flour, maize flour and beans as well as 10 sacks of charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it has fair requirements.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice, wheat flour, maize flour and beans as well as 10 sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single, and lives with seven family members, two of whom work.

Haydar has owned a large electric generator since 2008, leasing electric lines for his area and surroundings. He worked in this field for four years, so he has a good experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to purchase an engine for the generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase an engine for the generator

loans.name: Adpat 8 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupement se trouve dans une région proche de la capitale du Sénégal. C'est un groupement qui est constitué de cinq femmes, leur principale activité est le commerce. Seynabou est leur présidente, elle fait du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. elle sollicite ce prêt dans le but d'augmenter leur stock de marchandises. Avec ce crédit elle compte acheté des produits de mer comme (des poissons, des crevettes, des crabes) qu'elle va revendre au niveau du marché locale. Espérant que ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son pouvoir d'achat puisque la demande est supérieur à l'offre. Elle veut faire beaucoup de profits pour aider son mari dans les dépendes de la maison.
texts.en:
This group is found in a region near the capital of Senegal. It is comprised of five women, and their main work involves commerce. Seynabou is their president. She has been in commerce for over ten years. She is requesting this loan with the goal of increasing their stock of merchandise. With this loan, she intends to buy some seafood (such as fish, shrimp, and crabs) that she is going to resell at the local market. 

The hope is that this loan will enable her to increase her buying power, since the demand is greater than the supply. She wants to make much more in profit in order to help her husband to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school while one is in college. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Josephine has operated a retail shop for the past 10 years; additionally, she also owns a motorcycle for transportation. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail operators. She dreams of expanding her business and meeting her customers’ needs.

With the Kshs 100,000 (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice and sugar as well as a new motorcycle for her motorcycle business. She decided to join Yehu because of the fair requirements.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, rice and sugar also as well as a new motorcycle for her motorcycle business.
